author: {'steamid': '76561198367990549', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 10332, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5209, 'last_played': 1699269980}
review: Another great Serious Sam game from Croteam. Lot's of items in workshop. Tho' optimizations aren't... going back to workshop, a lot of interesting stuff and nicely optimized maps out there. So I'd recommend checking out the workshop. Of course the game's optimizations are trash. I've optimized it myself after searching for a couple of minutes and found out which useless setting to disable such as Flare lights etc. So, I usually play on 80 FPS stable in optimized custom maps and in TSE and TFE(which are both included in Revolution after you buy TFE or TSE classic separately, presume). Kinda had to read forums and steam discussions, but it worked. Now, onto the campaign. Bright Island's pretty good, is a bit fancy and the music also is similar to Serious Sam 2. Some structures are also similar to Serious Sam 2's. However, Bright Island's optimizations are terrible. Although I play on 80 FPS on most custom maps and in TFE and TSE(which again are both included in Revolution). But I get 20-50 FPS in Bright Island. I don't think any PC will be able to play Bright Island lag-free. I also encountered lag spikes which makes you think the game's gonna crash. Lag spikes are terrible, and it will also take quite a bit to load the levels. So, Croteam gotta improve/fix Bright Island, although I don't think they ever will. No complaints about TFE and TSE. They just work fine without any performance issues, or you can play the ones you purchased separately. Overall, 8/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969062133', 'num_games_owned': 2104, 'num_reviews': 1248, 'playtime_forever': 13, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1640886128}
review: A first person shooter about a guy in a t-shirt with a lot of guns named Sam who fights monsters and collects ancient artifacts and hilariously quips things like, "That's gotta hurt," or, "Damn, you're ugly." The game collects the first two Serious Sam games and a campaign called Bright Island, and is a time capsule from the early '00s with dated graphics and dated humor. The gameplay itself is okay. You move through levels fighting and killing a wide variety of enemies you encounter, and occasionally have an arena fight where you are pursued by dozens of enemies and have to strafe for your life. Oh and there's a survival mode too. The map design is okay though there's a frustrating number of encounters that are "enemies spawn right on top of you and you have to survive". Fun if you're a Serious Sam fan or want to play an older FPS but I'd rather play something else.

review:
Me and my best friend have a tradition to go through all the Serious Sam games around Christmas. Sometimes we skip Serious Sam 3, because it is dedicated entirely to Egypt and the scenery is the same as opposed to the others, but this is not the point of this review.

All good things begin with Serious Sam First (and Second Encounter) and you have them both in one place. That's right folks, both games all in one and it support multiplayer via Steam servers. Call your firends up and get down to some face smahing!

Marry X-mas from the face-smashing team!

author: {'steamid': '76561198052636113', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 3687, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 985, 'last_played': 1647707542}
review:
It is great. Old good Serious Sam plus an extra campaign. What is not to be loved? A tactical FPS stripped of all other elements focused on frantic action. Lovely on hardest difficulty mode. And one liners! One after another. The "cult classic" from the early 2000s

From the technical perspective, it doesn't add anything to the old Croteam engine. It is almost a port for modern OSes with minimal changes (gravity changes in some areas, even in the original encounters included and some weapons that were discarded from the alpha version can be found in some secret areas now). I would rather go with the HD versions, which despite the name are proper remasters. if you have never played and you want to take a sip of the 2001 graphics you can very well play this version and enjoy the extra campaign.

8/10 because it is basically a port, but in serious scale it is a Seriously serious/Serious

author: {'steamid': '76561198866790608', 'num_games_owned': 34, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 134, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 134, 'last_played': 1635714100}
review:
I am reviewing this because it is the only game I actually own, and I *need* those 25 precious, precious XP points. So. Was the game loved, and cared for, and updated? Obviously! Spoiled and pampered it so much it became the gifted kid who thought he was so grand and so smart, but who ended up selling himself on the street $5 a pop to buy the weed that is his only positive escape; the only thing that brings him any joy in his weevil-infested apartment. 

9.5/10. -0.5 points because Bright Island optimization sucks.

review: Great old school game. This version includes both The First Encounter and The Second Encounter and also a new Campaign called "Bright Island". You also get the two games separately which are the original releases. It has workshop support, so you can easily install mods to the game. I played more with this version, since it's more up to date than the original releases. Although if you want to experience the true old school feeling that you're experienced back then, play the original ones.

author: {'steamid': '76561198118155854', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 7516, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7501, 'last_played': 1652923694}
review:
Quality stuff. Both Original games and a new chapter - Bright Island.

Great atmosphere and nostalgic as hell. Reminds me of the lan parties I used to host with this game. Me and the boys on a rainy day, 8 different PCs and nothing but memories. 

Bright island is good too. Couplea new guns and some great atmospheric levels. Well worth grabbing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198365994958', 'num_games_owned': 51, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 1282, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 871, 'last_played': 1682911753}
review: The first 5 hours were heart pounding action. Little did I realize, this was only the 2nd level. the experience goes from intense fun to agonizing sadistic evil. Only the most malignant demons that even Satan disgraced would have crafted such an evil piece of software code. As I am writing this, I am currently trapped on one level, trapped in a loop of shooting and eternal suffering. when I look out my window and look at the sky. I don't think about the chance of God or beings beyond our compensation that we cannot comprehend, I think about the fucking sky I prayed to in serious sam as lens flares blinded my vision, whilist kleers flood and rip the intenstines out of Sam. When ever I walk or even listen to music, I can hear the klopping hooves of the enemies from this damn game. This fucking game. I keep turning around thinking they are coming for me. I think my fan is the faint scream of a kamakazi. I have dreams of being trapped in the yellow sandy hell that contains the evils of Serious Sam. Croteam has ruined my brain. I will never forgive these Croation mother fuckers for what they have done to me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002716193', 'num_games_owned': 716, 'num_reviews': 182, 'playtime_forever': 2181, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2181, 'last_played': 1632403495}
review:
*Warning: spoilers*

So, another Sam bundle mod.

At first, I thought, what is there to say. There are many Serious Sam Gold Editions, we have Serious Sam Fusion 2017, HD Remakes etc., what makes this different? At first, nothing, it is the First Encounter and Second Encounter, bundled into one program. But then I saw ‚ÄúBright Island‚Äù in the campaign options. This was unfamiliar for me, so I think I found the main difference here with the other bundle games. It has a completely new, custom-made campaign. 

The Bright Island campaign is a lot of fun, despite some players hating it as far as I saw. It introduces new levels, new enemies (or rather modded and merged versions of original enemies) like cute little Ugh-Zhan models, new weapons which are quite overpowered and new soundtracks. It has fewer levels then the First and/or Second Encounter but the levels are a whole lot longer which gives the impression that it is a quite long campaign. 

I found it amusing to find some of the Bright Island weapons in the First and Second Encounter, despite that you can only use them once because the ammo is not replenished anytime in the game.

Nothing changed in terms of graphics. In fact, they are even worse than the original games. I don‚Äôt know what happened, but tearing and visible outlines are so common that I mistook a border graphic line for a secret ledge with some goodies on it. Sound wise, except the new soundtracks from the Bright Island campaign (which I liked actually) nothing changed.

Even though I liked Serious Sam Classics: Revolution, it still has some issues like a messy start, glitched achievements and the weird graphical glitches that occur all the time. In terms of the achievements (something that motivates me always to play a certain game), it has some legit challenges to complete, which I enjoyed very much. But, like many games, it also had some ridiculous grind achievements like kill 100.001 enemies, something that requires you to play all three campaigns like ten times each or something to get it ‚Äúnaturally‚Äù. 

In conclusion, the only reason I recommend this version of Serious Sam is because it has something original and new to offer, namely Bright Island. For me it was a moment of refreshment, after playing the original games countless time.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983746737', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 155, 'playtime_forever': 1446, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1424, 'last_played': 1652659475}
review:
Yet another re-release of the original Serious Sam - we've had more of these than actual Serious Sam game entries from Croteam.

This one's pretty good, offering the original classic game levels and graphics, all the original bells and whistles like coop, splitscreen and DM, as well as exclusive new campaign maps and the unique integration of having both SS:FE and SS:SE in the same executable. Worth checking out and a must-play if you're a Sam fan.

review:
Per ora la mia recensione si basa solo sul "porting" di tfe e della campagna "bright island", dato che tse lo giocato molto poco.
Una cosa che ho notato nei due titoli che si possono trovare all'interno di questa collezione √® che ci sono molto problemi sia nel comparto sonoro, non a livello di qualit√† dell'audio ma nel senso che se un nemico mi arriva davanti com'√® possibile che io lo senta da dietro (in poche parole: audio 3d rottissimo), il problema √® che la remastered del primo capitolo uscita nel 2003 questi difetti di audio non ce li aveva.
Per non parlare del fatto che i caricamenti siano abbastanza lenti, eppure ho caricato il gioco sulla ssd e come ritorno a ripetere la remastered del 2003 questi problemi non ce li aveva.
Ritornando sull'audio:
Spesso non si sente il rumore delle armi nemiche, quindi ti trovi a dover andare in giro come un forsennato per capire chi nerchia ti stia sparando.
Beh che dire, pochi difetti ma che vanno tutti a colpire gravemente la giocabilit√† del gioco.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010160917', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 100, 'playtime_forever': 747, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 730, 'last_played': 1629235387}
review:
Terrible performance on the new episode even at minimum graphics settings.
You get frequently less than 40 FPS on a GTX970. This is a ~20 years old game...

I tried co-op on the new episode. The netcode is garbage. The whole world is flickering while I'm moving. At the boss fight (Bright Island) it just disconnects and/or goes out of sync. Totally unplayable.

Just avoid this and play with the Fusion. Even Serious Sam 2 is better than this.

review:
If you liked the original, then you'll probably like this. I loved Serious Sam as a kid. Hate it now. There's something about the old, weird style of maps that look like they were ripped from an old media cd for assets. It can get pretty frustrating at times, and with many other legendary fps games from that time era, I find it hard to want to push on with these ones.

Enjoyment Rating: 5/10
Difficulty: 5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198441281639', 'num_games_owned': 126, 'num_reviews': 120, 'playtime_forever': 7708, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 362, 'last_played': 1704128147}
review:
Serious Sam is the Croatian love child of Duke Nukem and twin stick shooters. This release gives you both the First and Second Encounters, with a third campaign made by the developers of this release thrown in. Also included is an additional difficulty mode, I Am Ugh-Zan, testing your knowledge of the map layout to the max as one of two random buffs can be applied to any enemy and damage is increased even further. Test your quicksave key and prepare for hours of repetitive strain injury.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=k5bNc0wpXIA&ab_channel=capt.Slygor

author: {'steamid': '76561198027453870', 'num_games_owned': 487, 'num_reviews': 224, 'playtime_forever': 201, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 172, 'last_played': 1654974666}
review:
Time to get Seriously Fanmade! 

Serious Sam Classics: Revolution is a official mod for the first two classic Serious Sam games with new modern features such as workshop supports and other major improvements. The game preserves the original model and maps in all of it's low poly glory. But this mod also includes a brand new fan-made campaign with brand new weapons and new monsters to shoot at.

Gameplay is... once again Serious Sam. Hallways, Arenas, Shooting, lots and lots and lots and lots of enemies and more shooting. If you'd played other versions of the TFE or TSE they'll be the same decent experience with some new secrets in store. But the brand new Bright Island Campaign is the highlight of the entire package. Brand new levels with a few new themes, brand new weapons to add to Sam's hefty arsenal, and brand new enemies based on existing foes. Overall, it was a pretty awesome expiereance and I'm kinda sad this campaign wasn't converted for Serious Sam Fusion 2017 or something using Serious Engine 3 as it's pretty for just 2001 styled graphics.

Overall, Serious Sam Classics" Revolution is yet ANOTHER way to play the orginial 2 Serious Sam games while also including a worthwhile bonus campaign. Not like amazing but not terrible. Now I would love to see some one port the console exclusive The Next Encounter to PC and get that on the Steam Store and we'll be complete.... well there is Serious Sam GBA, but.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025036032', 'num_games_owned': 3139, 'num_reviews': 171, 'playtime_forever': 1803, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 20, 'playtime_at_review': 1507, 'last_played': 1710711749}
review:
A strange, somewhat technically unsound, now abandoned port of classic TFE/TSE. Trade weird netcode and long load times for one click downloads on the workshops, and a new poorly balanced campaign called "The Bright Island". Try both on your hardware to see what works best. 
Comes with the classics, which are some of the best fps ever released.

author: {'steamid': '76561198154004822', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 311, 'playtime_forever': 426, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 426, 'last_played': 1616601072}
review:
[b]Kopf aus und drauf halten. Ein sch√∂nes Spiel f√ºr zwischendurch wenn man an Corona Langeweile leidet.[/b] 


[h1] Pro: [/h1] 
- Co-op obwohl es im Steamshop als Einzelspieler angegeben wird
- jede Menge Waffen
- gro√üer Umfang
- unterschiedliche Gegner, die in Horden auftreten, was bei der Physik und den Waffen Spa√ü macht
- Musik bei Bossk√§mpfen
- besser als die HD-Varianten (pers√∂nliche Meinung)

[h1] Kontra: [/h1]  
- Anfangs ist es lustig...irgendwann geht es einem dann doch auf den Keks...die ganze Zeit...AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA
- Es ist nicht immer ganz offensichtlich, ob man jetzt alle Gegner t√∂ten muss oder irgendwo in der gro√üen Stadt einen Schalter finden muss
- ab und zu kommt dazu zwar eine hilfreiche Sequenz...wenn dich aber ein Gegner trifft, denn das Spiel geht weiter, bricht diese ab
- sowohl bei first als auch beim second e. gibt es vor dem Bossfight ne ziemlich langweilige Stelle bei der man erst mal stundenlang rumsteht, um Welle nach Welle Gegnern zu besiegen
- Story

[h1] F√ºr Erfolgsj√§ger: [/h1]   
Die Erfolge sind leichter als bei den beiden einzelnen HD Teilen und au√üerdem gibt es hier wesentlich mehr Story Erfolge. Durch den Umfang braucht es dennoch einige Zeit alle zu bekommen und es gibt auch nach wie vor Mulitplayer Erfolge.


[h1] Fazit[/h1]
Es ist und bleibt ein Klassiker. Gerade das Gameplay mit den unterschiedlichen Waffen und Horden von Monstern ist einfach eine Klasse f√ºr sich. Story kommt hier sehr kurz, daf√ºr gibt es im Spiel selbst noch R√§tsel und unterschiedliche R√§ume und Herausforderungen. Auch das man es mit einem Freund...oder sogar Freunden zusammen spielen kann macht das ganze nochmal empfehlenswerter. (Schaut aber auf die Spawnrate der Gegner, sonst wird es schnell mal un√ºbersichtlich.) 
Grafik ist weit von heute entfernt, aber es hatte seinen Charme. 
Das einzige was mich wirklich gest√∂rt hat, war am Ende nur noch AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA zu h√∂ren.xD

author: {'steamid': '76561198305927607', 'num_games_owned': 323, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1181, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1181, 'last_played': 1600051116}
review:
[b]Overview[/b] - Serious Sam Classics: Revolution is a "Re-Make" of the first and second encounter of the serious sam franchise. Classics Revolution in it's creation is a fantastic idea that has all the best parts of the franchise. Sadly the game itself is a buggy mess, fitted with horrible optimization that makes many levels unplayable especially in the new map pack "Bright Island". 

[b]Pros[/b] - Classics: Revolution allows you to play both the First-Encounter and Second-Encounter along with "new" content, including cut weapons and new enemies in the main game and the Bright Island expansion. Revolution also works on a new engine allowing newer systems to play it well. This function however didn't really help me as it still ran horribly. The steam workshop also allows many fun mods like the textures from the amazing X-Box port of Serious Sam. 

[b]Cons[/b] - Revolution is terribly optimized and lags heavily in certain areas, Bright Island being one of them. Speaking more onto this expansion it is very much horribly designed, with many bugs in the terrain, textures, and many unfair enemies, one of which being a bio-mech with cannons, these of which one-shot you no matter the difficulty. The menus also feel extremely glitchy to me, having my game freeze and not be able to continue playing thanks to it. 

[b]Final Statements[/b] - Serious Sam Classics: Revolution is a massive disappointment to me, it feels extremely unfinished and half-baked. The game feels like it tries to be the X-Box port of Serious Sam which was the best way to play the games. This however is a worse way to play the classics in my opinion. The buggy menus, lag, and overall jank makes it extremely un-enjoyable to play for me. The experience might be different for other players but I do not recommend this game to others, The HD remakes are a much better way to play the games, and even the actual classics feel nicer. 

[b]Final Rating[/b] - 3/10

author: {'steamid': '76561199069562591', 'num_games_owned': 99, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 21579, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 16, 'playtime_at_review': 19670, 'last_played': 1709841565}
review:
[h1]TL;DR - buy it but be aware of some issues[/h1]

So:

[h2]That "feeling" of classics were gone here[/h2]
1. No camera shake while walking/running
2. No ammo icons shaking while shooting
3. Color of ammo text changes in more simple but boring way in compare with classics
[i](Yes, it matters)[/i]

[h2]New guns[/h2]
- "Ghostbuster" is broken due to screwed hitboxes for it, usable only agains groups of medium slow enemies like Minor Biomechs and Golems 
- MK II Minelayer is basically useless due to it's mine laying range - would be MUCH better to make mines travel like grenades in MK III Grenade launcher - the longer trigger hold the longer projectile travel distance. But I still managed to use it effectively
- Plasma thrower is fucking insane, love this gun so much. But I expected more good battle scenarios for it, especially when it picked up during Bright Island campaign, speaking of which...

[h2]Bright Island[/h2]
- Gameplay is good in most of the cases. "Most" because there's some strange difficulty spikes like that screwed room in "Sunken Pyramid" with jump boots or last arena in "Forlorn Ruins", but overall it's fun to play. New enemies make battle scenarious even more enjoyable except when Elder Arachnoid shows up, [i]who invited this guy?[/i]
- Optimization is just fucking hilarious. I got it that Alligator Pit wanted to show us once more the capabilities of SE1, but that's too much: when in TFE-TSE my FPS were NEVER below 120 FPS, in BI FPS is 40-50 most of the cases with microfreezes due to extremely high level of details on some structures (Sunken Pyramid start is perfect example) and lack of LODs on almost any part of any level (75%+ of Crystal Cove if perfect example)
- Environment design/art is good - levels are all quite different and enjoyable to watch (but not  to play in most cases, see previous point)
- Story is nice and fun, no known issues

[h2]Other issues[/h2]
1. There's a great but wasted potential with alpha enemies, I expected them to appear in Bright Island campaign when I started it for the first time
2. Wish more levels for BI or (which is more preferable) upgrade existing ones, see issues with BI
3. Wish more survival levels AND fix existing because I found interesting and challenging only "Lynx Town", "Christmas Survival" ([i]where's Jingle Bells?[/i]) and... That's all! The other maps are broken: "Bear City" cleared by me solo in first attempt; "Down the Vats" is a joke - it's extremely easy and even can be cheesed by standing behind one of the walls; "Neon" doesn't save record time for some reason and etc. So overall "Survival" mode just exists because it can, but I still got some fun ([i]What a feeling to clear a survival map![/i])
4. New difficulty level is more like a joke than actual difficulty level because just rising the HP bar and raising damage output for enemies without any gameplay changes for player is the most lazy way to raise the difficulty, but I actually liked ice and fire mods for enemies but it is not without issues: fire just could burn you to dust when you 100HP/100Armor when ice just slow you like for a second, it's very unbalanced. 
[b]My suggestion for this difficulty?[/b] Ok, here it is: Ammo amount is identical to "Hard" difficulty but spawns are taken completely from "Serious" difficulty + add variations for enemies with new spawners (for example, 70 Kleers + 10 Minor Biomechs + 3 Major Biomechs + 2 Juvenile Arachnoids + March Hopper Biomech + 4 Headless Bombers + 10 Gnaars is MUCH MORE FUN AND DIFFICULT than just 100 Kleers) and use new places (many unavaible heights for player are vacant for headless guys and of course for damned Arachnoids). The point is to stimulate a player to use their arsenal as effective as possible - the highest difficulty MUST HAVE to be a good challenge, ultimate skill test etc. For example I found Chainsaw, Single shotgun, Knife, Minelayer and Colts underrated, so let them shine in highest difficulty!

[h1]Does that mean that game is bad?[/h1]
No. It has many issues, but still it is great and enjoyable. [b]The main advantage over classic TFE and TSE[/b] surely is easy modability/workshop support which allows us to make content easier for that great game and makes it easier to access this content - [i]what else do we need?[/i] :D

[h1]Conslusion[/h1]
If all fixes (somehow today or tomorrow) would come live than after that I might say that Serious Sam Classics: Revolution is OP version of existing classic TFE and TSE and I would just play it like... Forever. I already have more hours in SS:R than in TFE and TSE combined but I would play more and more often with highlighted fixes. I love this series so much and I want to enjoy it more [spoiler]so I will create my own levels then, I completed the whole workshop by now (no jokes, I'm insane!!)[/spoiler]

[b][i]It's just all in details, but detains is everything we got[/i][/b]

So, after all, solid 8/10. Buy it, frustrate a little bit, and enjoy it.

Edit: I've discovered excellent "Classic Patch" by Dreamy Cecil which fixes most of the things I've mentioned and "CP" is just OP version of Classics, so I recommend you to play it

author: {'steamid': '76561198155730654', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 946, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 419, 'last_played': 1662362595}
review:
I absolutely love Serious Sam Revolution!
It's the classic first and second encounter bundled up into one package, with a brand new third campaign.
But the best thing about it is that it's interface, HUD and options have been redesigned for modern standards.
The original menu and HUD look very dated, but in Revolution, it's a lot more pleasant, you get to even tweek specific settings, increase the FOV, set the window to borderless etc.. There's even an option to change the game's HUD to look like the classic one if you really want.

author: {'steamid': '76561198347791795', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 468, 'playtime_forever': 1298, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 367, 'last_played': 1695335846}
review:
Serious Sam Revolution is an update to the original games. The First Encounter and The Second Encounter bundled together. Updated graphics, an extra campaing called Bright Island and a few small changes here and there.

+3 campaings in one game.
+Updated graphics. Its not like jaw dropping or anything but its there.
+Steam Achievements.
+Just like the other Serious Sam games. Turn your brain off, get in, shoot some enemies, get out. Easy to get into, easy to spend time in, easy to leave behind. Quick fun.

+/- Has pretty much all the same positive, negative and neutral points from the original games. For example when reviewing The First Encounter I complained that it was 90% deserts and it got boring to look at after a while. That issue still exists here obviously.
+/- There is 3 new weapons but from what I read in another review they're hidden and you have to find them. I couldn't. I only saw one of them but I didn't know how to get to it as for the other 2 new weapons I didn't even see where they were.

-A surprising amount of freezes and hard crashes. The 3rd and new campaing, Bright Island, seems to be a lot harder on my computer then The First Encounter and The Second Encounter campaings.
-Same difficulty issues as the previous games. TLDR: playing on normal or above means you'll rip your hair out because you spent 28 more bullets then necessary 5 mins ago and now you don't have enough ammo to beat the 12564th horde so you're kinda fucked. Playing on Tourist or Easy is more comfortable but it makes the game feel a lot more boring because nothing really poses a danger to you anymore.
-Repetitive gameplay which can make the game boring.

Just like with The First Encounter and The Second Encounter I'm leaning more on the "I was bored while playing" side rather then the "I had fun while playing" side so I'll give the game a thumbs down. Is it a bad game? No, not really. If you want a horde shooter I think Serious Sam is one of the best horde shooters you can find. Its just that... After trying the games out I've realized that no matter how cool I think Serious Sam might be the gameplay just isn't for me. I suck at it.

author: {'steamid': '76561199071285401', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 1265, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 433, 'last_played': 1705538163}
review:
Serious Sam Classics revolutions es un conjunto de serious sam TFE y TSE m√°s una campa√±a adicional. Desallorrado por Alligator Pit y Croteam y publicado por Devolver Digital. 
En esta entrega se nos muestran como un peque√±o remake o relanzamiento de los primeros encuentros con el motor gr√°fico y la interfaz mejor modificada. Viene con una campa√±a extra con un nombre y cantidad de niveles que no recuerdo.
Parece ser una idea que llama mucho la atenci√≥n, y si a mi tambi√©n.  juegu√© los primeros encuentros, y al final quise jugar la dicha campa√±a extra.
Aqu√≠ es donde viene el problema, la campa√±a debido a sus INMENSOS mapas y su cantidad de objetos en pantalla va a 2 FPS por segundo aveces incluso sin mostrarlos en pantalla. Hasta las explosiones bajan los cuadros por segundo, y no intenten aumentarlos bajando las opciones gr√°ficas y el rendimiento, 
no aumentar√° ni bajar√° ning√∫n FPS, la √∫nica forma de arreglar el baj√≥n de FPS es teniendo una nvidia Rtx y nada m√°s.
Sin mencionar que ni siquiera hay autoguardado en mapa as√≠ que acu√©rdate de colocarlos con el F6.
Lo mencionado anteriormente es la raz√≥n por la cual lamentablemente no recomiendo este producto, lo cual me rompe en coraz√≥n ya que soy un gran seguidor de esta gran saga. Pero en parte si lo recomiendo por los primeros encuentros.
No recomendado

Mi calificaci√≥n es de 5,5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198080693273', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 2599, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2225, 'last_played': 1613791988}
review:
Insanely fun and immersive series of games that perfectly blends dumb action with great immersive environments. 

It's rare that you find games that do this so well as Timesplitters did. Game that are mostly arcade shoot em up types yet feature fantastic ambient music tracks that immerse you into each environment as well as constantly introducing you to new weapons, abilities and good humor as you blast your way through the repetitive gameplay.

Pros: 
-Great graphics
-Great weapon assortment 
-Fantastic soundtrack 
-Hilarious corny humor 
-Amazing multiplayer and challenge modes 

Cons: 
Sometimes levels can get a bit too repetitive, requiring a bit of a break before continuing the shooting action


Verdict:
9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197996919908', 'num_games_owned': 1529, 'num_reviews': 869, 'playtime_forever': 260, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 260, 'last_played': 1601498193}
review:
[h1]Doppelter Spa√ü [/h1]

Urspr√ºnglich war ‚ÄúSerious Sam: Revolution‚Äù eine Idee von Fans, die ersten beiden Spiele in einem Titel zu vereinen. Das Projekt wurde allerdings sehr ged√§mpft, schlussendlich aber vom Entwickler Croteam zum Ende gebracht und dann kostenlos an alle Spieler verteilt, welche die originalen Spiele schon auf Steam besa√üen. Sch√∂ner Zug!

[b]Gameplay[/b]
Die ersten beiden Spiele ‚ÄúSerious Sam: The First Encounter‚Äù und ‚ÄúSerious Sam: The Second Encounter‚Äù zeichnen sich durch 5 besondere Merkmale aus: Eine riesige Anzahl an Feinden, dicke Waffen, gro√üe Level mit offenen Arealen und Geheimnissen, Humor und spa√üigen Spielen mit der Physik. Mit der schieren Feindeszahl und der abwechslungsreichen Art, wie sie dem Spieler pr√§sentiert werden, wird das Spiel trotz seines Alters nicht so schnell langweilig und das Gameplay stimmt einfach im Allgemeinen. In ‚ÄúRevolution‚Äù kann man zudem sowohl im Koop als auch im Versus Modifikatoren benutzen. Witzig wird es zum Beispiel, wenn man die Gegnerrate einfach mal auf 400% setzt, dann eskaliert dieses Spiel so richtig. Selten k√§mpft man ja schon √ºberhaupt gegen die normale Anzahl an Feinden in einem anderen Videospiel. Abseits von den Modifikatoren gibt es aber auch an anderen Stellen kleine Verbesserungen und teilweise auch neue Level, die von Fans gebaut wurden. Ein paar Objekte gibt es obendrauf auch im Workshop zu finden.

[b]Story[/b]
Es begab sich zu der Zeit, in der ein B√∂sewicht namens Mental die Erde vernichten wollte und ein Mann namens Sam daherkam und seinen Schergen so richtig fies in den Hintern tritt. Auch wenn die Level sicher irgendwo ihr eigenes Theme haben und sich die Aufgaben nachlesen lassen k√∂nnen, tritt die Geschichte von ‚ÄúSerious Sam‚Äù doch stark in den Hintergrund. Abschlachten ist hier die Devise!

[b]Grafik/Sound[/b]
‚ÄúRevolution‚Äù sieht nur leicht besser als das Original aus und ist leider nicht mit den etwas besseren HD Varianten der ersten beiden Spiele vergleichbar. Aber daf√ºr hat es seine Physikspielchen, die bei der HD Version entfernt wurden. Und wenn man sich durch das Feuerwerk der Schlacht bahnt und grunds√§tzlich nur noch Feinde sieht, f√§llt einem die Grafik gar nicht mehr so auf. Die Soundeffekte sind aus dem Original erhalten geblieben und gerade die Musik im Bosskampf rockt einfach immer noch hart.

[b]Fazit[/b]
‚ÄûSerious Sam: Revolution‚Äú w√ºrde ich empfehlen, wenn jemand Interesse am alten Serious Sam hat. Seien wir mal ehrlich: Die beiden Encounter und der zweite Teil zeichnen die Spiele bis heute, w√§hrend die anderen Titel nicht ann√§hernd so viel Spa√ü machen. Ich rate wegen den fehlenden Physikspielen von den HD-Remasters ab und empfehle stattdessen das aufgepeppte ‚ÄûRevolution‚Äú. Es macht auch nach fast 20 Jahren noch richtig Spa√ü und bietet die volle ‚ÄûSam‚Äú-Erfahrung.


Wenn du dich noch f√ºr andere Spiele des Franchises interessiert, k√∂nnte dir vielleicht mein [url=https://steamcommunity.com/groups/Drakeschool/discussions/4/2970650017901384407/]Serious Sam Leitfaden[/url] ja weiterhelfen, bei dem ich mir extra f√ºr dich die M√ºhe gemacht habe, diese ganzen Spiele und jeweiligen Versionen mal halbwegs √ºbersichtlich zu pr√§sentieren.

review: 3 scrapped weapons are amazing, the gameplay is fun just like the original but I could say it's better to play the original version due to the bugs this game have a lot. Somehow it crashed when I want to open it up. Though I could say, the pros about this game is we can play online server without using any outside dedicated server, just go into the lobby then bam you can play with your friends either co-op, deathmatch, ctf or even scorematch (due to the dead of GameSpy, I didn't have a chance to enjoy co-op for 7 years If I'm not wrong). So, this game is recommended for those who wants to play coop with your friends, but for singleplayer campaign, the original is much more preferable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030855908', 'num_games_owned': 699, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 4780, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2600, 'last_played': 1692743730}
review:
Ok, let's get this out of the way ‚Äì the first and second encounter are great games, and still hold up to this day. This version does include both of them ‚Äì but if you have the original, or the HD version ‚Äì in my opinion this version has very little to get you play it.
This version of the games, comes with widescreen support and newer windows, but ‚Ä¶ we have longer load times, and slower save times. It includes a new campaing with newer levels and weapons.Some of the weapons are scrapped from the Alpha version + the music is taken from the Xbox Port (but if you have not played it before, as I did you would think is new music.) But all in all, the new levels are great, and have a great feel to them, the atmosphere is there.
The only complain I have, is the loong load times ‚Äì even on SSDs, and fps drops in some of the new levels which is kind of annoying, but if you can endure those problems, I think you will have a fun time with it, I had it received for free, because I owned all the of franchise ‚Äì so I have no complains towards that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011170236', 'num_games_owned': 1426, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 302, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 177, 'last_played': 1684998724}
review: A must have for fans of the franchise. It's the most cost efficient way of playing the classic versions of the first and second encounter. I think the HD remasters are great, but the original games are also worth experiencing in their original engine. Revolutions also comes with a brand-new campaign called Bright Island. It is hard as balls and feels like something that could have been in the first or second encounter while still being a unique experience. The game also comes with mutator options for co-op play. If you don't have any friends to play this game with, I would recommend just playing "co-op" with yourself and reloading every time you die, which is the exact same experience as playing singleplayer. I don't know why mutators are exclusive to co-op, but the workaround is so easy that I'm willing to let it slide. My favorite mutator is the "alternate enemy spawn" mutator, which replaces some but not all enemies with different ones, many of which are either brand-new enemies created by Alligator Pit or resurrected enemies that were cut from the original games. This allows even more replayability to the franchise, and I think Alligator Pit did a very good job at making the alternate encounters feel authentic and challenging while still being fair. They're definitely harder though, so I would recommend turning this off for your first few playthroughs.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961123003', 'num_games_owned': 657, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 481, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 275, 'last_played': 1703515044}
review:
Serious Sam Classics: Revolution is a re-compilation of the original Serious Sam: The First Encounter and The Second Encounter. For those that prefer to experience the vanilla games without the HD remaster, this is currently the best way to play them. Compared to the originals, there are some very minor modifications to enemy spawns, item placement, and secret activations for some levels. An extra campaign with new levels, exclusive to SSC:R is also included.

Be sure to play this in co-op if you can ‚Äî it's Seriously fun especially on the hardest difficulty, where there are more enemy spawns to keep you on your toes. A great action-packed stress reliever, and one of the best co-op games that you can enjoy over multiplayer or local split-screen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198202376076', 'num_games_owned': 215, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 693, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 651, 'last_played': 1677431334}
review:
This is NOT a good way to play the first entries in the Serious Sam franchise.
Laggy servers. Inconsistent framerate. Sound issues. Corrupted save files.
Go play the original versions of the First and Second Encounter instead.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058750465', 'num_games_owned': 996, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 6469, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6469, 'last_played': 1598630970}
review: As of this review date I cannot recommend Serious Sam Classics: Revolution as it‚Äôs still a buggy mess. It‚Äôs unfinished; it lacks polish with terrible pacing and difficulty issues with the original games as well as the Bright Island campaign. Add to that unstable servers that will randomly cut you off, crashing and achievements that might not unlock after hard progress. I know it‚Äôs free if you bought the original games but Croteam need to sort these problems out if they want something that‚Äôs more than 50% playable. Back to Early Access until much needed improvements have been made.

author: {'steamid': '76561198257374012', 'num_games_owned': 101, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 1270, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1270, 'last_played': 1599997033}
review: Serious Sam Classics: Revolution is a nice collection of the original First and Second Encounter games and ties them together nicely into a seamless experience. There are many customizable aesthetic features as well as a new campaign called "Bright Island" which features 8 new levels, new weapons, and new enemies. The level environments in Bright Island are very cool but at times you will find yourself going through large open areas with not much happening. Overall though I can't say I didn't enjoy it; if you want your Sam fix then I'd recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076141576', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 2014, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2014, 'last_played': 1598485651}
review:
Another one of those times I wish there was a "neutral" option for Steam reviews.

-THE PORT-
As a port and way of playing the original Serious Sam games, this is a pretty solid port. It keeps the original graphics and adds a lot of quality of life features like widescreen, customizable hud and a ton of graphical options. On top of this, by getting Revolutions you also get the Classic games so you still have that in case you prefer it.

I would normally tell you that this is the best way to play the game while keeping it's original style, but this port is almost ruined by one big flaw: loading times. For a 2001 game, this thing has extremely long loading times which make it quite annoying to play, having in mind that SS is a game where you're gonna die a lot.
I still had fun but it's definitely something you should have in mind

TL;DR: Great way of playing with the old graphics, long loading times make it frustrating to play tho.



-BRIGHT ISLAND-
This campaign is also a mixed bag. In terms of visuals it's really great, it has some amazing landscapes that look beautiful even with this old engine, sometimes it makes you just wanna stop playing and look around.

The gameplay on the other hand is just kinda there, it's your standard SS firefights, although the spawn rate was a bit slow in certain places: there was a fight where I managed to kill all the enemies while they were still spawning so I just ran past them. Yeah, just left the arena with them still spawning, essentially skipping it.

Onto the bad, the lesser of problems is that in the later levels, it starts borrowing (and with that I mean almost copying) SS2 levels and even using their music, which is not a bad idea. It's great when you can see any kind of familiar place in SS that is not just a desert, the thing is that playing in these enviroments with the old movement and without all the upgrades to the gameplay that SS2 brought just makes you wish you were actually playing SS2 instead.

The really bad problem is optimization: again, this is a campaign for the Serious Sam Encounters and for some reason, whenever there's a really big area the fps just tank hard, going down to around 25 fps in the worst of cases, making the game just hard to play at times.

TL;DR: Decent campaign, great visually, meh in terms of gameplay, with some really bad optimization problems.

author: {'steamid': '76561198303130412', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 8333, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6083, 'last_played': 1596412840}
review:
1. This game is paradise for players who simply want to make use of their core fps skills. 
2. Very addictive and a real challenge on hard difficulty. Definetely videogame history. The atmosphere is not serious but funny and the main aspects are shooting, positioning and speed. This suits me better than the "new" Doom Games which are comparable in many aspects. But this is without the annoying finishing moves, less jumping arround and brighter atmosphere. No horror, no worthful story, no mystery, but a lot craziness. This game is 100% about playing and shooting tons of enemies! What is brilliant in my opinion. There are secrets, which will make you laugh like "secret Trap found" and thinks like that. There is also enough gore and blood in it,

author: {'steamid': '76561198272326993', 'num_games_owned': 601, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 1315, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1011, 'last_played': 1679947449}
review:
Serious Sam Classics: Revolution is the best way to currently play the classic Serious Sam games on modern machines. This game retains the classic art-style of the originals (that was arguably lost in the HD remakes) while adding a large amount of features that add greater accessibility. In addition to the First Encounter and Second Encounter, this release includes a new campaign, "Bright Island", though it's not very good. This game should be bought for the two classic Serious Sam games, something it has the best versions of. Still, be aware that Serious Sam is not for the impatient and there is a learning curve to overcome.

PROS:
- The fantastic shooting gameplay from the originals are kept intact
- Great weapons, maps, and enemies that make combat challenging and varied (mostly)
- Nice classic visuals that have a charm not seen in any other Serious Sam game since
- Decent performance overall, with a huge number of settings available to change
- Great value, will take a new player around 15 hours to beat the First Encounter and Second Encounter

CONS:
- The new Bright Island campaign is not good and quite amateur
- Some of the later levels in the First Encounter really drag, but this is an old problem
- Some minor performance hangups and slight deviations from the original (though they are unnoticeable to all but the most seasoned Serious Sam fans)

author: {'steamid': '76561198391728294', 'num_games_owned': 151, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 1282, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 72, 'last_played': 1605854247}
review:
The plot is exactly the same as the First and Second Encounters, so I won't go over it here in detail. But here's the short of it: a guy named Sam goes back in time to fight aliens in ancient times, and some huge battles ensue.

With the exception of Fusion, this is the best way to experience both Encounters, in one executable. Plus, hey, there's a new fan-made campaign and enemy variants, as well as new weapons. Pretty much everything great about the first two Encounters also applies here.

author: {'steamid': '76561198306839681', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 9666, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1717, 'last_played': 1708398616}
review: Es un pack bastante bueno, contiene los 2 juegos originales y una nueva campa√±a, mas nuevas armas sacadas del contenido eliminado del juego, estos salen en la nueva campa√±a llamada Brigth Island, pero pueden ser encontrados en las campa√±as normales. Las opciones de HUD, etc son bastantes buenas, es genial que puedas poner el hud de xbox, las nuevas armas son decentes son solo 3, una sinceramente es muy generica, es solo un lanza minas sin chiste, pero las otras 2 son muy buenas, sobre la campa√±a nueva, es bastante buena y desafiante, aun que el jefe final cae en lo injusto, pero los niveles en cuanto a aspecto son una bolsa mixta, hay niveles que se ven bien, y otros que no tanto, demasiado acartonados. Otra ventaja de esta version de los juegos originales, es que esta tiene una Workshop (cosa que hacia falta) asi que puedes descargar aspectos o niveles a tu antojo, lo unico malo es que no tiene un menu de Workshop y sinceramente no se como activar o usar muchos de estos. Y otro aspecto es que el Online es terrible, no siempre encuentras gente y cuando lo haces hay mucho lag, parece que todos juegan en dimensiones diferentes. Recomiendo este pack son los juegos originales con mas contenido y una nueva campa√±a, un modo survival y un modo multijuador bastante completo. Algunos preferiran las versiones HD, pero sinceramente prefiero mas contenido y mejoras que simplemente el mismo juego pero mas bonito.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011488392', 'num_games_owned': 1420, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 2979, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2922, 'last_played': 1694242814}
review:
Somehow ends up being worse than the standalone classics in a number of noticeable ways. Off the top of my head, I've noticed that it removed view tilting and underwater view tilting effects, small hud scaling at 4k while it didn't have a problem with that in classics, gravity effects in TSE levels seem weirdly jittery by comparison, it seems to somehow have more input lag for me than the classics and the netcode is hot garbage even compared to the classics somehow. Its only really redeeming factors in my eyes is the novelty of putting TFE and TSE together, Bright island has a few cool levels in it and workshop support even if workshop for it is mostly dead.

Just play the standalone versions even if you get this for free

author: {'steamid': '76561197988121364', 'num_games_owned': 691, 'num_reviews': 113, 'playtime_forever': 297, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 123, 'last_played': 1601623754}
review:
Quick and to the point: this is a fan-made Croteam-supported upgraded bundle of the first two Serious Sam games, The First Encounter and The Second Encounter.

Engine and visuals are basically the same as the originals, but with support for modern resolutions right out the box and with some more tweakable settings. LOD can be jacked up far beyond what is possible in the original games, for instance. Runs like a dream on modern hardware.

Some might ask why bother with this when the HD remasters exist, that ported the games to the Serious Sam 3 engine. Well, there were some parts of the games (Second Encounter especially) that couldn't make the transition to the new engine. Many sequences that screwed around with gravity, like a huge room where you can run straight up a wall fighting monsters all along the way, were cut out in HD. There's some other differences too, but the level edits are the most notable.

As it stands, Serious Sam Classics: Revolution is THE BEST way to experience The First Encounter and The Second Encounter as intended, with all content intact and compiled under a single executable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198130384996', 'num_games_owned': 112, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 390, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1591943525}
review:
First-Person Bullet Hell
Advice for anyone trying to make their game look like a fifth-generation console release: Don‚Äôt tamper with the levels in display.

Bright Island
First level: Typical Serious Sam fare with some backtracking
Second level: Full of sluggish platforming segments and jumps to lower levels that the Serious Engine can‚Äôt handle smoothly
Third level: Tightrope walking over a damaging floor that this engine isn‚Äôt equipped to handle well, although it‚Äôs much more brief and forgiving than the bottomless pits of the second level. This leads into an elevator that in turn leads into an ambush by a pit of Zumb‚Äôuls which almost killed me the first time through.
Fourth level: There‚Äôs a single health pickup that spawns a Beheaded Vaporwave.
Later on, there‚Äôs more precarious platforming with walkways that use gratuitous invisible walls.
Fifth level: Typical Serious Sam fare, although there‚Äôs a Storm Golem that can only be killed by projectiles. You wouldn‚Äôt know that on your first time through, and I almost died until the Beheaded right behind him killed it by chance. I suppose the Grenade Launcher is introduced in the same level as an implicit connection, although it‚Äôs too distant to be meaningful.
Sam says "man, I hate dark passageways!" which is your only hint to the Kleer ambush that kills me as I walk through.
After that quip, it‚Äôs the same gratuitous invisible walls, and it‚Äôs visually beginning to remind me of the levels from Donkey Kong Country. There‚Äôs leaps of faith, but they‚Äôre less egregious and a lot more generous.
A wide open platform where the two-directional rocket guys and Harpies are swarming you? Sam ends it with "Suicide isn‚Äôt the answer," which feels more directed to the poor player who likely died hundreds of times on this segment rather than the Kamikaze Beheaded.
I clear through the next wave, which is much less mentally demanding even though the enemies are tougher, and when I wait for the door the Ugh-Zans spawn right on top of me and kill me as soon as the cutscene ends.

author: {'steamid': '76561198263427469', 'num_games_owned': 442, 'num_reviews': 246, 'playtime_forever': 960, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 960, 'last_played': 1587817873}
review:
My favorite FPS game in childhood.
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2073550748

Very nice game. I have passed it several times in 2001-2005. Found it on Steam and decided to give it another try. I played it for a couple of evenings. And it was great. 20 old game is still great.

SS is classic FPS shooter. It reminds DOOM a little, because there are TONS of enemies. To pass the campaign you need to kill 6500 units. Not bad, yeah?

Enemies can be spawned everywhere. So you need to constantly be aware and running around the level. Prepare for thousands of save/loads, because picking +1 health can summon a rocket mech in 2 meters from you.

Weapons are different and all useful (grenade launcher is less useful).

It took 16 hours for me to complete the game (7h40m is pure time, other is save/load). And I liked it 90%. My only complaint that latest levels are too long (takes 1.5 hour to complete them).

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2073550697
Pros
- Pure action. Run and Shoot. No puzzles, speaking, necessity to hide and etc. Just be Rambo!
- All weapons are needed. Most of them are fun to use.
- You fight at small rooms in some levels. Other missions offer you to fight in a huge area against tons of monsters.
- Monsters spawn constantly. You pick something, new enemies appear.  Each room/area can have several waves of enemies. It is cool
- Cool enemy features. Skeletons, Kamikaze and bulls are my favorite.
- The game is full of secrets. It is fun to seek them.
- Final of the game is satysfying.

Cons
- Latest levels require 60-90 minututes to complete them. You can easily get tired.
- Where are all Egyptians?

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2073550840
[h1]Resume[/h1]
Great game. I passed it several times when I was a child. I did it again in April 2020. It is still. Alligator Pit improved UI, I liked it. People who never played SS, should play HD version instead, because it offer same gameplay!

author: {'steamid': '76561197981766246', 'num_games_owned': 99, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 1163, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 719, 'last_played': 1586877718}
review:
Excellent classic FPS experience. I remember playing The First Encounter when it came out almost 2 decades ago and the game has aged remarkably well as of this iteration. Both First and Second encounters are beautiful games - the texture art in classic, low poly renderings is beautiful. Enemies are repetitive, predictable and rather dumb, and come at you in droves. Weapons are largely satisfying especially the super shotgun, the cannon, and the grenade launcher. I wish we had better effects and sounds for the laser gun, the basic shotgun, sniper rifle and flamethrower.

There are occasional bugs such as autosaves from points of no return, and the jumping puzzles and traps in these games are rather annoying at times (although not as annoying as the recent Doom Eternal's silly puzzles). There are parts of the game that have no rhyme or reason, where you're just wandering through symmetrical hallways with keys or tokens or other objects that you have to collect to go through doors. This game mechanic gets old very fast. What doesn't get old is the satisfying gunplay. This game could teach more modern FPS games a lessons in how to build an excellent combat FPS experience.

Serious Sam has always been irreverent and self-aware in how it doesn't take itself seriously, and that is the most refreshing thing about the game. The funny one liners and quips you hear from time to time make the playthroughs very satisfying when juxtaposed with the gunplay and pretty graphics. 

All in all, I'm glad I purchased this classic - it is a steal for the significant length (some 20-25 hours of gameplay perhaps, with plenty of repeat value) and quality combat FPS gunplay, and with the possible exception of some annoying and cheap puzzles, it is a very fun experience.

Highly recommended!

author: {'steamid': '76561198046426881', 'num_games_owned': 389, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 3376, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1867, 'last_played': 1640973010}
review:
I'd like to announce that the Serious Sam series is the best arcade FPS game ever created. Outstanding map progressing; they are not the same, although the same environment is often used in several maps. Ahh, the music. A bunch of maps usually have this "background music", and when action happens, the background music transforms into action music. There are so many playlists you will not get bored, I guarantee.

All of the fights against the "alienish" enemy is unique, maps will not get you bored, loads of "secrets" and other stuff going on, smart but funny puzzles, nice graphics, and the way you progress in combat is up to you. 

Will make even the toughest-minded smile

Maps 12/10
Music 10/10
Combat 11/10
Environment/graphics 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561199027946152', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 18747, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 794, 'last_played': 1707429470}
review: Well...what can I say? IT'S SERIOUS FREAKIN' SAM! The first 2 encounters, classic, all combined and retouched so that it still has the classic feel but a more modernized experience of the game. Loads of community created maps and mods are available through here, and theres a couple new secrets I believe. Some bug fixes (obviously) the survival maps are wonderful of course. This brings a good amount of new content to the game pre-installed, and virtually infinite more you can get from the workshop. Steam achievements add on to the experience even more! HUD Theming? Amazing! Much love for Croteam, and I'll be looking forward to Serious Sam 4: Planet Badass! I've played every other one in the series other than XXL (and the other ones in that same play style) and the VR editions. Oh yeah, I almost forgot to mention; When you buy this, you also get the 2 encounters added for free; so basically, (without a sale going on) you are getting a $22 deal for $9.99.

author: {'steamid': '76561198127804039', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 6921, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6242, 'last_played': 1685900116}
review: It's a fast paced game with a lot of aesthetic to it. Revolution also provides a opportunity to play community maps. Most are astoundingly well done. You can feel the love for the game coming from them and it makes playing through them that much more pleasing. Due to the variety, quantity and length of some of these maps, I would safely say in addition to the 20 smth hours it takes for you to finish both games, you have 150+ hours worth of community maps.  If you take a liking to it at first glance, I'd recommend getting it. while on sale, it's under a buck, it never gets stale and the community is still producing maps.

author: {'steamid': '76561198163386590', 'num_games_owned': 425, 'num_reviews': 158, 'playtime_forever': 2812, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2090, 'last_played': 1680133730}
review:
[b] So,I`m rewriting this review and I can say that if you want to play Serious Sam The First/Second Encounter with more of the original vibe and not being in HD,this one might be for you. [/b]

Mods work fine so far,especially the XBOX mod,which was the reason i wanted to play this damn version in the first place.

Now,I`m not exactly sure how many experience it,but Bright Island was painful to complete,mostly because it`s the buggiest part of the game,mostly suffering major lag,for example,my FPS is mostly 60-120 normally but when playing this custom campaign it falls down to less than 20 FPS most of the time,in a nutshell making it unplayable on higher difficulties as you need quick reflexes to not die. And some hybrid custom enemies make an appearance,such as all elementals besides fire or beheaded who shoots on ALL directions,but the most BS ones to fight imo are the biomechanoids,the yellow one who spawns frogs,and especially the green one who fires CANNON balls at you,which if it hits you,you are dead,even on Tourist. And if you thought the levels in TSE were a bit too large,play Bright Island.

One positive thing I liked where the "new" weapons added as secrets in TFE/TSE such as the Ghostbuster weapon which was an scrapped Alpha weapon originally,but it`s hitbox is inconsistent with the enemy,mostly seen when shooting it at the kleers or biomechanoids.

Plasmathrower was one of the most fun weapons to use,and it has an alternate firing shot too but at the expense of ammo,I wish it was featured in other SS games.

And the minelayer is...meh.

Aiming feels good too,like the HD remakes,unlike the originals where it felt twitchy to aim.

One thing i hated that they changed was the inclusion of invisible walls on some levels,mostly obvious in Great Pyramid,which makes rocket jumping pointless so if you want to skip the majority of the level or if you want to speedrun,yeah...avoid this version of SS.

I haven't played COOP yeet so i can't say if it`s good or bad,I`ll update the review in the future.

Also Split-Screen is unplayable,as either one movement or aiming will control everyone else`s too.

In a nutshell,a decent version of the original SS,if you want to play SS with mods,certainly this is one to get.

[h1] 7/10 [/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198158396003', 'num_games_owned': 504, 'num_reviews': 221, 'playtime_forever': 1904, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1154, 'last_played': 1707234008}
review:
[h1]Though Serious Sam TFE (The First Encounter) and TSE (The Second Encounter) are good games on their own, I think the Classics Revolution "Bundle" is what you should get over the 2. [/h1]

[b][u][h1]Reason 1[/h1][/u][/b]
[b][u]It's more configurable[/u]. In the real 2 classic games, you could change the FOV, but only with a console command. Here, there's a slider in "Game Options". You can change the blood/gibs color to something not red to make it feel more "cartoony", or, maybe you don't like red blood. 

[b][u][h1]Reason 2[/h1][/u][/b]
[b][u]Better Mod Support[/u]. SS:CR has a Steam Workshop component which allows you to download all sorts of things from the Workshop. I recommend using the Xbox Overhaul mods.

[b][u][h1]Reason 3[/h1][/u][/b]
[b][u]It comes with the first 2 encounters for the same price both games normally are (9.99 USD)[/u]. So, not only do you get a whole lot of settings and mod support, but you also get the first 2 encounters, along with a bonus level.

[h1][b]TLDR; Serious Sam Classics: Revolution is a great, updated version, of the first 2 encounters, and should be played by any shooter fan.

author: {'steamid': '76561198110960935', 'num_games_owned': 454, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 3041, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1482, 'last_played': 1592155203}
review:
Serious Sam is not a low-budget Doom, like some seem to think. It isn't doom at all, in fact, it really is just it's own thing. 

At it's worst, it's a slog; a pain to get through certain parts, and can be just plain frustrating due to the fact that the game puts out way too much at once. 

However, at it's best, it's an extremely fast paced, action packed, high adrenaline horde shooter. Basically, it's like an FPS version of Smash TV. If you enjoy a game which has a heavy focus on fighting armies of enemies at once, then you might like it. It is kind of niche, but I really enjoyed Serious Sam TFE, TSE, and Revolution. Consider this a blanket review from all 3 of them, since I feel about the same for all of them.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041017157', 'num_games_owned': 913, 'num_reviews': 121, 'playtime_forever': 5930, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1748, 'last_played': 1701525545}
review:
Revolution aims to bring The First and Second Encounters to newer hardware.  Now, this isn't a bad thing in itself, the main campaigns remain solid, there's the Steam Workshop that allows you to play user levels easily, and there's even a new campaign called "Bright Island".  It's all nice, but I'd argue it's not the optimal way to play those games as of right now.

For one thing, the crosshair occasionaly screws up in that [u][url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZKt-1fc2blA]it completely misses the target[/url][/u] even when you're aiming at an enemy, this isn't all the time and I'm not sure if it's just Revolution, but it's annoying when that happens.  The other thing is that the lighting can be weird, I don't have an example for this, but there are weird shadows that flicker, again I'm not sure if it's just Revolution, but yeah that can happen.

But anyway, the main campaigns as I said are as [u][url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/neon_henchman/recommended/41050/]they[/url][/u] [u][url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/neon_henchman/recommended/41060/]were[/url][/u], they're very solid.  There are however some extra weapons like the Plasmathrower and the previously-scrapped Ghostbuster.  They're entertaining weapons, but they don't exactly work right; the Ghostbuster would go through enemies without damaging them and the Plasmathrower would sometimes kill a Biomechanoid in 3 hits, sometimes 2, they're not consistent, but they're still fine additions that adds to your arsenal.

Bright Island is a pretty good campaign, the action is on par with the regular games (although there are less annoying gimmicks like those in TSE) and there are times where it simply looks gorgeous, but the coop can be screwy, at least when I did it alone for an achievement; at some point, I got the Plasmathrower in the second level, but then I died for seemingly no reason when I fired it (the description says that if you fire it to a wall next to you, you take damage, but I played it on Tourist and weapons don't harm the player at that difficulty) and when I respawned, I no longer had that weapon.  That was a bummer, but I proceeded on, only to get stuck when a Wind and Mud Golems appear; the Mud Golem died, but the Wind one wouldn't be hurt by my weaponry, and so I concluded that the Plasmathrower at the beginning was the only way to hurt it, so I had to replay the whole level again just because of that incident.  Again that was a shame, but then it did it again for the final boss; I had a Canon at some point, but when I investigated the pool in the middle of the arena, I died instantly and  when I respawned, I no longer had that weapon for the boss, plus I had little ammo for everything else.  That was kind of a lame experience, but I'm not saying the action wasn't good either.

Revolution also has more of a focus on scoring, which I like a lot, you can aim for the best scores on individual levels and there are online leaderboards to top it all off.  This serves as an expansion to the gameplay, but there are a few things I'd suggest; for one, there isn't the upgrades added to the scoring in the HD versions, mostly the bonus that gives you points if you never load a save, optional challenges, and, okay maybe I just want HD again at that point, the score multipliers depending on the difficulty.  Secondly, and this is the one I'm mostly concerned about and why I would want score multipliers depending on the difficulty or at least some bonus points like adding 25'000 Points on Normal or something, but if you play on Serious difficulty, that usually gives you the most points, but if you play on I Am Ugh-Zan difficulty, which is Serious but even harder, you absolutely need to surpass the previous score for it to count, what I mean is that if you manage to equate the score, your highest score doesn't update to the hardest difficulty, so in my case, Hatshepsut is forever recorded as being completed on Serious instead of I Am Ugh-Zan.  So there are a few things I would adjust.

There's also a problem when you uninstall the game to then reinstall either on another drive or a new computer, it loses the levels you unlocked in the process.  You don't lose your best scores thankfully, but it means you have to replay through all of the levels again, including Workshop campaigns.

Lastly, there's an issue with the menus and the mouse, which I guess happen when you have dual monitors and play in fullscreen; be careful when you leave the game screen because it will be as if the mouse on the PC is not where it is in the game, it's not calibrated properly, so whenever I try to click on something to the left for example, the mouse focuses onto something outside the game, so I would be leaving it frequently, and sometimes the game crashes when that happens as I play in fullscreen.

I know I make it sound subpar, but as I've said the campaigns are great and the Workshop can be entertaining, it's still a lot of fun to play, it's just that I hope future updates will fix those issues I have, because as of right now, I would rather play the regular Classic versions of TFE & TSE as I didn't had issues with them, or if it's scoring we're talking about, I'd go back to HD.

review: I am fan of Serious Sam series since my childhood. I still have original discs with SS FE and SS SE. I love those games. They gave a lot of information about lands that we move through and while doing so,they also give us lot of informations about our enemies. Graphics maybe are not the best,but they still have it's charm. And Revolution just mixed both of those games together,added somethings to them and even created more maps in which we can destroy monsters left and right while finding secrets. Music is just amazing. Big part of that is nostalgia talk but that nostalgia is still with me. I don't really play revolutions since I know FE and SE already but it's fun to go with others at multiplayer. It's just amazing to go back to childhood and play with others while having lots of fun while doing so as well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027360733', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 6383, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5877, 'last_played': 1580659333}
review:
There should be little I need to say about Serious Sam. It's old-school, testosterone-fueled over the top action.

This remastered edition contains both the First and Second Encounter, as well as the brand-new Bright Island campaign, some weapons that were cut from the original games and several survival levels. Furthermore, it brings much-needed features such as wide-screen support and compatibility with newer hardware and operating systems.

For the longest time, the whole project seemed stuck in Early Access Hell, due to, as the (volunteer) devs at Alligator Pit put it, "life happening" until Croteam picked up the slack and pushed the game to the finish line earlier this year. Since then, development has been steady, most of the major bugs have been ironed out and the new achievements are working as well.

If you were a fan of the original Encounters, or are just looking for an old school shooter, it's well worth your money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042483391', 'num_games_owned': 304, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 379, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 110, 'last_played': 1646049802}

author: {'steamid': '76561198012677927', 'num_games_owned': 296, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1560, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1003, 'last_played': 1657135673}
review:
the game its self is fine, but there's one glaring issue with the engine, there's a term called shot delay. when you have a bunch of Kleers circling around you and you flick to aim at them most of the time your shot doesn't connect (as if your playing on 200+ ping with no client side prediction enabled) I've caught several issues with this on my live stream, the most glaring one was standing still, scoped in on the sniper rifle at a wearbull dead on and it missed. On serious difficulty this is a massive problem.

this bug alone makes me want to stay with the fusion version. I legit wanted to see what the classic game was like and experience what the gravity gimmicks were like and the differences in level design. there were a few really cool things. however untill this fix this issue I would avoid this one

review:
[quote] [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/36579661-Setna/] Ba≈ülamadan √∂nce diƒüer incelemelerimin olduƒüu k√ºrat√∂r sayfamƒ± takip edin.[/url] [/quote]

Mod cenneti.

Serious Sam Revolution, serinin fanlarƒ±ndan olu≈üan bir grup baƒüƒ±msƒ±z geli≈ütiricinin eski oyunlarƒ± geli≈ütirmeye ba≈ülamasƒ± ve Croteam tarafƒ±ndan da desteklenmesi sonucu ortaya √ßƒ±kmƒ±≈ü bir yapƒ±m.

Serious Sam oyun motorunu bir nebze g√ºncellenmi≈ü haliyle yayƒ±nlanan Revolution aslƒ±nda tam olarak bir oyun deƒüil. Evet, kendine has ufak √ßaplƒ± bir hikayesi dahi var fakat oyunun √ßƒ±kartƒ±lmasƒ±ndaki esas amacƒ±n bu olduƒüunu d√º≈ü√ºnm√ºyorum. ƒ∞lk iki oyundaki oynanƒ±≈üla aynƒ± oynanƒ±≈üa sahip. Revolution'un p√ºf noktasƒ± desteklediƒüi mod √ße≈üitliliƒüi. Steam At√∂lyesinden bulabileceƒüiniz √ße≈üit √ße≈üit modlara sahip. Yapƒ±mcƒ±lar da zaten eski oyun motorunun geri kaldƒ±ƒüƒ±nƒ±n farkƒ±nda olarak ufak birka√ß g√ºncelleme ve uygun bir fiyat ile yayƒ±na sunmu≈ülar. Hatta eƒüer Serious Sam Classic oyunlarƒ±na sahipseniz √ºcretsiz olarak hesabƒ±nƒ±za ekleniyor. Ger√ßi √ßok dert etmenize gerek yok Croteam √ßok a√ß bir firma deƒüil o y√ºzden oyun fiyatƒ±nƒ± 18‚Ç∫ gibi √ßok uygun bir fiyat ile satƒ±≈üa koymu≈ülar. Kaldƒ± ki takip ediyorsanƒ±z Serious Sam oyunlarƒ± sƒ±k sƒ±k √ßok u√ßuk indirimlere giriyor (u√ßuktan kastƒ±m bazƒ± paketler %98 indirime filan giriyor cidden u√ßuk yani).

ƒ∞≈üin √∂z√º yapƒ±mcƒ±larƒ±n "Madem bu kadar klasik Serious Sam oyunlarƒ±nƒ± seviyorsunuz, alƒ±n size klasik oyun motorunun g√ºncellenmi≈ü hali, alƒ±n √ºst√ºne bir de hayvan gibi mod desteƒüi ne yapƒ±yorsanƒ±z yapƒ±n!" kafasƒ±yla √ßƒ±kardƒ±ƒüƒ± bir yapƒ±m.
