author: {'steamid': '76561198080218537', 'num_games_owned': 740, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 16168, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11407, 'last_played': 1692309613}
review:
[b]This review was written for 1.01, future patches may (but will hopefully) remedy the problems listed here.
Due to a character limit, the map-by-map bright island sections have been cut from this steam review, you can read them over on the full review here: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1tTJAdl7j-TJO8KsECwI1FmSWq_Z3RPVTWn3rE3-AwUA/edit?usp=sharing
[/b]

So it has finally come down to this: a day I had not seen coming.
Revolution is finally out of Early Access, or so we thought.

I‚Äôve been playing it with my knowledgeable old timer friends, and we all agree this is just mediocre. The best way I can describe Bright Island is as the 2nd coming of Dark Island.

So a bit of a history lesson, what is Dark Island? Dark Island was an official mappack that shipped with Serious Sam Gold, aka the precursor to Revolution and Fusion that combined both titles before Serious Sam Xbox. It was a mappack made by a now ancient and likely never heard of mapper called Trisk, he was given (I think a few weeks) to make a mappack to ship with Gold. At the time (2002) there weren't very many active mappers and Trisk‚Äôs work beforehand included Marsh Wastes which was not the best. Dark Island in of itself ended up being a mediocre expansion to the series then, and it still feels that way today to me.
I had joked before about Bright Island being the sister counterpart to Dark Island, but I had never thought they‚Äôd have this much in common.
Except Rev likes to crash, alot more (even on closing), there‚Äôs that too sadly.

Now I‚Äôm not going to be pointing fingers at specific people, because that‚Äôs uncalled for but largely because I don‚Äôt know who is responsible for this. Was this Alligator Pit‚Äôs unfinished work or was this Croteam‚Äôs intervention at work? Who knows, what I do know is what we have now is not what we were waiting for.

So let's start with some decent things the game FINALLY has working netcode after all these years! The music is quite nice and quite a few areas do look quite pleasing. The combat starts off ok in the first map, which is one of the better ones, but even outside the gate there‚Äôs some problems. We're all pleased thou that the netcode is finally playable and works, thank you Croteam for that! Now, for context we were playing coop with 3 people, no enemy modifiers, and on serious difficulty. Ok, let's begin:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1inZaD-9gVY
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bsnXGCgCXGQ
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UYPElAGWTpI

PS: Solaris has confirmed a few insider facts:
The cannonball biomechs were a leftover mistake in the 2nd map and weren't supposed to be there, lets see how long until CT patches it.
The entire campaign was played only twice before CT greenlit it and launched it, would explain the beta but I guess at this point most people moved on.
Rev was going to get pulled from the storepage soon (ET a few weeks) if the game didn‚Äôt exit early access and deliver on the promised content, Alligator Pit wasn‚Äôt going to finish it, so Croteam stepped in.

Other criticisms:
https://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198167898153/recommended/227780/
This review (and I would have pointed it out there if the author accepted comments, or better yet, steam never implimented that stupid feature into reviews) that the new enemies ARE NOT new to Bright Island (expect maybe 1), those have been in the game, for years, for YEARS, the reason you never saw them is because there arn‚Äôt any custom maps using them (any good maps that is) and pretty much no one messed with the enemy randomizer feature.
Oh yeah! And these aren't even new to Rev either! The XBOX mod for the second encounter had marsh hopper spawners, and the Serious Violence Mod had Cannonmechs, this is even talked about in our video playthrough series! Do your research first before you write an overly cynical review and think your tough shit about it.

Some other more historic things:
The beta test had this map called Christmas in Karnak, it was later removed when the game officially launched 1.00 and out of early access. Likely something that slipped into the beta by mistake as it was very unfinished.
The originally bright island intro map had some kind of protection on it that prevented people from opening it in the editor (would just stop loading the map), I found a way to bypass that thou :3

Final Verdict:
Alligator Pit got lazy, Croteam picked up the pieces, and we have Rev that‚Äôs practically still in early access but without the banner simply so it wouldn‚Äôt get pulled from the store still full of alot of problems, less problems than before, but still a lot.
There‚Äôs only been like 10 reviews since the game left early access, which leaves me to believe most who had hopes for bright island have already left and moved on, I myself was planning to write this review when SS4 dropped to leave my complete history with the series since 2002 and how CT fucked it up, but that can wait, if CT fails SS4, but for now this is about rev, not SS4.

And as it stands, don‚Äôt buy this, at least not yet.
Unless your bend on collecting all the games in the series or the classics. And even then wait for a sale or get the original classics on GoG.

Serious Sam Revolution still needs work.

author: {'steamid': '76561198173837779', 'num_games_owned': 226, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 15018, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13960, 'last_played': 1708875818}
review: –°–ø–∞—Å–∏–±–æ –∑–∞ Serious Sam HD: Classic Revolution –∏ Bug Island! :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198167898153', 'num_games_owned': 180, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 3010, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2787, 'last_played': 1666540191}
review:
I've played quite a bit of this multiplayer with friends and it was generally TFE or TSE which work more less okay. 
Then there's Bright Island which would be the crowning jewel of this pack.
My only question is WHY? Bright Island had to be the most miserable experience I've ever had playing Serious Sam. 
It's buggy, the new monsters are god awful. Yeah dude, let's like make a buffer version of the suicide bomber that throws bombs OR DUDE HOW ABOUT A MECHANOID THAT SPAWNS MARSH HOPPERS till you kill it (spoiler: they're usually far in the back and good luck hitting them behind the twenty tons of other lovely mobs that just keep spawning in huge gangs here) and I thought the nightmare stopped till I saw 5 or so Mechanoids WITH CANNONS NOT ROCKETS. First time I saw the thing i wasn't even sure what killed me. I won't even go into the great elemental monsters. But what could possible be better than the new monsters?
CRASHES! There's a lot of those now. I'm not sure if the black screen bug where you hear sound but see nothing has been around for long....but by god the crashes through out Bright Island.....I had a tough time with the last boss. Not because of his absolutely lovely projectiles or the fact that more elemental golems drop from him after being hit oh noooo IT WAS THE CRASHES. 
The 2 hour or so experience took me 3-4 days to complete because every single time it was either the new monsters, amazing spawning places and amounts of said monsters or crashes that would get me to close the game. 
Did we really need this campaign? And you my dear reader, do you really need to buy this stupid thing? Just get the HD remakes instead. This is worthless and adds nothing to the experience. And the new campaign first drove me into madness and then into this overly long rant review. I honestly thought the first few levels of SS3 were the worst this series could get....boy was I wrong. In its current state Bright Island is just not worth it.

review:
I had my hopes up when croteam took over and revived this remake of the classic serious sam games, but they should've kept it in early access until it was deemed truly ready.

The current state of this game is still poorly optimized, especially with the new release of Bright Island, which is currently a mess filled with bugs and other gameplay related issues.

Go play the original classics instead and wait until the game receives more bug fixes.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993396330', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 9006, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8104, 'last_played': 1570139520}
review:
[i]Not Much of a Revolution[/i]

Croteam seem somewhat dedicated to fixing this (for how long though) and I'll honor their efforts by changing my formerly negative review into a positive one, even if just barely.

Hopefully they have learned their lesson and won't outsource any of their IPs to amateurs anymore that will abandon the project halfway through, forever to fester in Early Access purgatory. It has hurt their brand and it seems they've come to acknowledge that.

Bright Island is still mostly a joke from a gameplay perspective, but at least now you can actually finish it without running into any gamebreaking bugs.

As for the original SS:FE and SS:SE singleplayer campaigns: They're as good as ever and well worth a playthrough!

Multiplayer is literally dead so I don't know how much of the netcode issues of the classics were fixed, if any.

[b]6.5/10[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198048464955', 'num_games_owned': 300, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 651, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 538, 'last_played': 1569601975}
review:
Serious Sam is not a bad game or series. This reboot, however, is bad. And partially that's not because some concepts are bad or not thought out, but mostly because they never got around to actually developing anything.

The last update was three years ago, the game is still in early access.
Last I played it, there were major hit registration issues in singleplayer.
Crashes related to workshop weren't particularly uncommon.
Promised content is nowhere to be seen.

And the worst part is, development's been put on an indefinite halt, meaning this is an Early Access Abandonware.

review:
If you ever wanted to play Serious Sam with slightly better graphics then this is for you

Pros
You get The first 2 encounters with slightly better graphics

Cons
This game has been in early access for 5 years now and I doubt it'll ever be finished
Considering it's still the same engine I think this could've just been released as an update for the old games but nah cough up some cash for some slightly improved graphics 

I can't get into Serious Sam but even if I was a fan I'd still feel like this is a ripoff you'd have to be a die hard fanboy to enjoy this that or just not own any other versions of the first and second encounter

author: {'steamid': '76561198092667528', 'num_games_owned': 294, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 9530, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7774, 'last_played': 1679644707}
review:
[h1]Serious Sam Revolution is ok[/h1]

The reason why I still don't recommend this version of the Serious Sam classics is that it's still unoptimize and still has some problems. Bright Island is the worst offender, it's basically unplayable for how poorly optimized it is. 

I don't know if it's the game using an old Opengl API version or what? But what I know is that the base games work perfectly fine but with some annoying stuttering and Bright Island is unplayable. Unless they update their system requirements than this problem can be ignored.

[i]I still do recommend the original classics over Revolution, they are the definitive versions to get.[/i] I would also say get Revolution so you can get the First and Second Encounter for free.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996000877', 'num_games_owned': 635, 'num_reviews': 174, 'playtime_forever': 1090, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 533, 'last_played': 1601310289}

author: {'steamid': '76561198062813911', 'num_games_owned': 1952, 'num_reviews': 2041, 'playtime_forever': 183, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 183, 'last_played': 1549409386}
review:
[h1] DISCLAIMER: This is a full review, and NOT a first impressions review

ANOTHER DISCLAIMER: Serious Sam Classic: The First Encounter, Serious Sam Classic: The Second Encounter and Serious Sam Classics: Revolution's reviews are more or less the same as the gameplay mechanics are basically the same in both games. So please think before commenting about the similarity in the reviews [/h1]

[quote] PLEASE NOTE: This review is/was written when this game was in/is still in Early Access. Think twice before buying/playing this game [/quote]

Serious Sam Classics: Revolution is a game developed by Alligator Pit and Croteam and published by the wonderful peeps at Devolver Digital and is created by the Serious Sam fans

The gameplay is like that of old classic games, such as DOOM and Wolfenstein where you shoot enemies non-stop in huge arenas whilst getting keys, objects, health and ammo. The arenas are huge and sprawling, full of Egyptian scenery

The music and sound effects are cool, so nothing new there. The sound effects are good but you can hear the difference in sound quality, sometimes poor to sub-par. Music too was the same, the music quality varied from poor to sub-par but this is understandable

The only thing that bugged me was the enemies, they were annoying to say the least. Always running towards, knocking down your health like there no tomorrow and Serious Sam runs so slow that even my late grandmother could run faster than him. The game doesn't feel as face paced as other arena shooter games I've played

Serious Sam Classics: Revolutions was a good first part into the introduction into the Serious Sam series, created by the fans for the fans. On another note, if I had to recommend either the classic versions or the HD remakes, I would go for the HD remakes. Although I would still recommend the classic versions of Serious Sam, I think the HD remakes still hold up

[h1] RECOMMENDED :) [/h1]

[b] REVIEW SOURCES: [/b]
[list]
[*] None

author: {'steamid': '76561198416188624', 'num_games_owned': 531, 'num_reviews': 498, 'playtime_forever': 244, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 116, 'last_played': 1570272797}
review:
While it has many new options and includes both First and Second encounter, the new movement controls sucks character doesn't stop exact moment I release key which makes platforming tedious.
It also has a whole new campaign - Bright Island. I beated it whole and it was fun for sure, but a few ideas were a bit lazily executed and balancing is very poor with difficulty spikes and giving way too much ammunition, but still it's pretty good and I would recommend it to hardcore Serious Sam fans, just wouldn't recommend it to average players.


6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198047762652', 'num_games_owned': 371, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 1112, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 864, 'last_played': 1708626081}
review: Early Access that has been abandoned. It's kind of good but yeah don't bother buying this. Get the First and Second encounter some other way. There have been no updates since 2016 and let's be real here, if you want to halt development temporarily, that's fine, just make sure you tell the customers that development will be halted and for how long. What matters is that we're promised that something will be done sometime in the future. Two years of absolute silence can't be tolerated.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013487480', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 4369, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4046, 'last_played': 1667851994}
review:
This Version of Serious Sam will be in Beta forever.
What has been done was to port (copy) the Maps from "Serious Sam Classics The First Encounter" and "Serious Sam Classics The Second Encounter" into one Game "Serious Sam Classics Revolution" with new Gamemodes and Maps.

For Buyers who like to create custom content:
New functionalities have been added to the already existing Entities.
So this means, it is possible to easily port Maps from one Version (or even Mods) to another Version inside of Serious Sam Classics but not for Serious Sam Revolution because the already existing Entities have been modified to add the new functionalities and not added new Versions of them to the already existing ones, so it's incompatible.

(I got both Classic games too by buying this Game... so its a good price)

author: {'steamid': '76561198262626587', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 373, 'playtime_forever': 333, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 103, 'last_played': 1609802004}
review:
What is Serious Sam Classics: Revolution ?

Revolution picks both of the Classic versions (not the HD remakes) of the first two serious sam games and combines them into a single game with a few changes and more customization, thats pretty much it, the thing is I see no reason to waste your time with this version, if someone wants to try the first two serious sam games the HD version is still pretty good and the improved visuals just make it more modern and better-looking overall plus its much easier there to set your server to play with a friend but for someone who just want to experience the older style of the Classic versions they can go just play them instead because they still stand out pretty well even today, this standalone release is just useless and sometimes even more glitchy, I also found that setting servers here to be much more unstable, I was getting DCs all the time or having other weird issues while I never had any trouble with any of the other Serious Sam games when playing online and Ive played all of them, the only thing that this standalone release brings is a new campaign called bright island that just sucks with horrible level design, poorly designed enemy encounters and crappy balancing which I dont recommend playing at all when you have so many better fanmade maps, Revolution is just a very useless release that should be skipped, pretty much that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023637915', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 20, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1523420892}
review:
As much as I love the Serious Sam franchise, this game is not the way to go. You would be much better off spending on the HD remakes instead. Just to list off a few key differences that I noticed in the little amount of time that I play of this compared to the HD: 1) HD has surround sound, meaning you can hear the direction and distance the enemy is coming from, whereas this just has their noise, making everything sound the same. 2) Within playing this little amount of time, I had two huge framedrops, making it virtually impossible to aim or move (don't remember that ever happening on HD). 3) It's been nearly 4 years since this has been released and yet there is no vasts content changes. Currently, this is just the two games combined with a promise of another campaign, that I fear we will never see.
All in all, HD just is better in general giving the same content but with better performance. If Revolution ever releases the campaign, I would give this game another try, but until then, I'm sticking with HD.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055347902', 'num_games_owned': 1046, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 472, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 472, 'last_played': 1520288286}
review:
Do yourself a favor and play this game on normal. This game wants you dead and it doesn't care how it does it. Expect to be ambushed constantly. It doesn't matter how experienced you are with FPS games, deliberately bad enemy placements can down even the best players. 

The levels are gigantic and Sam walks quite slow. Despite being so large, the levels are barren and empty with giant empty fields. 

That said, when the game clicks with you, there can be lots of fun to be had. This game is from back in the day when gameplay was more important than garbage storylines and superfluous cutscenes that plaque most modern games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198172096253', 'num_games_owned': 214, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 631, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 611, 'last_played': 1530350035}
review:
I'm not really sure what to say about this. On one hand it's Serious Sam - First and Second encounter in one + some extra features (Survival Mode, Achievements, Steam Workshop) which is very nice, on the other, it's kinda buggy (Albeit completely playable) and seems to be abandoned by the dev.

If you own both The First Encounter and The Second encounter and would like to have them in one package (And that's all you want), you can do that yourself, I know because I did that once, it's fairly easy to run TFE in TSE without messing anything up so look up how to get that and do that instead.

If you never played Serious Sam TFE and TSE, I would recommend getting this, despite it being seemingly abandoned it does work and it does it's job well enough. 

+ Serious Sam - First and Secound Encounter in ONE
+ Workshop, Achievements, Survival, Misc. Goodies
+ Classic, Awesome, Non-Stop FPS Action
+ Enemy Variety
+ Decent Arsenal of Guns
+ Expansive Levels
+ Great Selection of Difficulty Settings

- Some Annoying Bugs [Being unable to get out of water easily without holding shift is most annoying]
- Seems Abandoned [At least from what I can see looking at other reviews and discussion pages]

o If you want good graphics and somewhat more modern feeling gameplay get 'Serious Sam: Fusion' instead

review: Intense action both in 1P and MPer.  Graphically it looks really nice even if it is not on par with today's AAA gaming graphics.  A nice choice of weapons making killing interesting.  I think the cut scenes are pretty cheese so I guess that is a minus.  Anyway this here is a must buy / must play for shooter fans.

author: {'steamid': '76561198314618697', 'num_games_owned': 91, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 108, 'last_played': 1538406179}
review:
How should i review this?

So, this game is quite okay.
The devs forgot about this game so there are no Updates in this game, ever.
This game has both Serious Sam: The First Encounter and Serious Sam: The Second Encounter with more HD graphics, i guess.
This game also has Multiplayer. Sadly there are no people playing on Multiplayer. Since this game is kinda dead.
Arena mode is included.

There was planed to be antoher Mode or Story in this game.
But they forgot about this game and just abandoned it.
This might stay Early Access for a very very long time.
Or it might never be a Complete Game.

I just would not buy this. Go Buy Serious Sam 1
It will be alot better and complete.

6 out of 10
Would not really play it.
Although Arena mode is fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046819158', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 84, 'playtime_forever': 92, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54, 'last_played': 1620233804}
review: Este juego es perfecto. La obra maestra de la saga, y eso que no esta terminado. Es coger todos los  mejores juegos que han sacado de serious sam y hecharlos a un caldero, sasonarlo con mucho HD, buena interfaz, workshop, vr, nuevas graficas, mejora de la compatibilidad tanto con controles como del juego en si, un nuevo modo de multijugador, combinar los splitscreen de los anteriores juegos en uno solo. El juego es perfecto.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967271190', 'num_games_owned': 310, 'num_reviews': 84, 'playtime_forever': 1265, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1265, 'last_played': 1510418963}
review:
Pros: 
Free due to owning the original First & Second Encounter
Nice Graphics for an old game
Plays well (no crashing)
Controls work well

Cons:
Early Access for ~ 3 years
Game has a lot of bugs
Slow Loading Times
No 21:9 3440 x 1440 Support (Played in 1080p windowed)
Doesn‚Äôt play well with Rivatuner Statistics Overlay 
Multiplayer is Dead

author: {'steamid': '76561197983545926', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 348, 'playtime_forever': 816, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 816, 'last_played': 1505788716}
review: Serious Sam is an FPS classic. It still holds up to the present day. While TFE is rock solid, TSE left a lot to be desired for me. I made it to the bouncy room and had to put the game down. The level design just went out the window around that time for me. Apparently the dev has abandoned this game, according to other reviews, so I 'don't recommend' solely for that reason. TFE and TSE HD might be the way to go for these old titles if you don't want to run the originals.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040196744', 'num_games_owned': 229, 'num_reviews': 203, 'playtime_forever': 284, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 284, 'last_played': 1505689977}

author: {'steamid': '76561198050374170', 'num_games_owned': 443, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 1103, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1075, 'last_played': 1632142392}
review:
It's been almost AN ENTIRE YEAR that Revolution is not updated. 
[url=http://steamcommunity.com/app/227780/discussions/0/1473095331490420700/]And even if the main dev stated that is not abandoned[/url] it's still unacceptable that we didn't get informed about the progress of the game for almost a year, instead they focused in Bogus Detour, stating that a different team is working on it. 

For the game itself, It's like I remember, the old classic Serious Sam games with workshop support and an improved(?) engine . It runs pretty well on both modern hardware and even toasters. HOWEVER it's still very buggy sometimes and doesn't support fullscreen apparently, so I don't reccomend buying it both for the bugs, and for Scratch's awful behaviour on his community, unless you really want to play the classics instead of the HD versions (at this rate, you better go stick to Serious Sam Fusion 2017 if your pc is pretty powerful).

EDIT: Fixed a typo

author: {'steamid': '76561197968421642', 'num_games_owned': 185, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 6427, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6058, 'last_played': 1702605277}
review:
Updating my review, because my initial one was negative at the time against Alligators pit's initial lack of care.

The game is now updated and  a lot of the initial issues I ranted about have long since been fixed.

Just a fair heads up, classic mods are backwards compatible but need some adjustments to truly work.

Bright Island was pretty disappointing to say the least, definitely not worth the wait but maybe you'll think otherwise.

Don't download too many workshop mods, the game gets fussy when you have too many.

If you want an updated variant of the classics, this is the route to go. I strongly recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012705885', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 5161, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1705, 'last_played': 1671833394}
review:
UPDATE : Croteam stepped in and added the Bright Island campaign to the beta branch of the game, as well as fixing up a bunch of bugs. Thank you!

First off, this is the classic Serious Sam from 2001/2002. Can't go wrong with that. If you dislike the Serious Sam games, you will dislike Revolution. As simple as that.

This re-release of the game game is actually in good shape and runs well on modern hardware - but Alligator Pit had stopped patching it altogether from December 2016.

One of the promises of this version was a whole new campaign - Bright Island. This was delivered only now, nearly 3 years since the last patch.

With all of that that said - it's Serious Sam!

author: {'steamid': '76561198059288391', 'num_games_owned': 162, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2399, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1718, 'last_played': 1699440544}
review:
So one of the very first games that I got on the xbox as a kid was Serious Sam, and even then when I was super young (maybe 6 or 7? Somewhere around there?) it was a super fun game. Some things happened, xbox broke, consoles i wasnt interested in playing came out so i switched to steam. When I found out that one of my favorite childhood games was on the steam store, and I could get it for 10 bucks i bought it super fast. Truly as the title suggests, a classic

So lets get on with the review already. There are definitely some upsides as well as some downsides to this game. Some strengths that this game includes is :
Amazing Campaign
Lovable MC
Enjoyable Gameplay and Atmosphere
Good Guns
SUPER SRS (not really tho)
Hundreds of secrets
Workshop capabilities
Online Co-op hosted on steam servers
Fun playerbase
Highly customizable

Some downsides include:
Still in early access, creator abandoned the work (the campaign is still fully functional however)
Sometimes the net code is really buggy depending on internet connection between host and player
Severely outdated graphics/gameplay (however the nostalgic gameplay could be a plus to some)
Terrible PvP (in my opinion)

In any case, Serious Sam is a great game as well as a great series. SS2 And BFG are also fun games, but I prefer this one the most. 

TL;DR: Fun Nostalgic Shooter with amazing campaign and workshop that makes for a good time with friends. Highly recommend, a 4.5/5 game for sure.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009485644', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 108, 'playtime_forever': 64, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 64, 'last_played': 1491269906}
review:
Update:
Shortly after I spoke to Croteam's PR guy (Communications dude) about the abandoned state of SS Revolution. It was announced that Croteam would be stepping in to help finish the project which was great news and so I have changed my negative review to a positive one.

https://steamcommunity.com/games/227780/announcements/detail/1597010908192988236

I'm yet to play the final release as the early access problems left a bad taste in my mouth but I certainly plan to now that Croteam have saved the game.

========================================
Original Review:
========================================

Its Serious Sam, what could be the problem? 

Well the Developer stopped working on this (I see it as abandoned) to go work on another Serious Sam game called Serious Sam's Bogus Detour. Bogus detour, the irony. 

http://steamcommunity.com/groups/revdev

http://steamcommunity.com/id/ansjh

So enjoy my money whilst I don't enjoy an unfinished game.


Edit: The last update was December 2016. http://steamcommunity.com/gid/103582791433828347/announcements/detail/704082951008291186

2nd Edit: Its now over one year since the last update. The developer that was meant to be working on this when they were working on Bogus Detour is now working on new Hammerwatch game. 

I'd avoid the crap out of this unless you enjoy games that will probably never be finished and games that the developer shows no interest in.


**3rd Edit (Jan 2019)** - When I stated that this was abandoned to work on Serious Sam Bogus Detour, the developer mentioned above told me I was wrong and that it was a completely different team even but I did not believe them for reasons I won't go into here. 
Well now that same developer has no probelm saying on their twitter that they worked on Bogus Detour, so they are also liars. https://steamcommunity.com/app/227780/discussions/0/1744480967036679699/

author: {'steamid': '76561198103128893', 'num_games_owned': 219, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 28, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1498914714}
review:
Serious Sam Classics: Revolution = First Encounter + Second Encounter + more

At first I thought this game would be some kind of mix of the first two games with some extra but you can literally play them in order.

Easy in this is the same as hard in the 3rd game. More or less.

Some people don't like this game due to the lack of "story" but for me, completing levels and having some sort of destination is O-K.

I wouldn't say the graphics have aged well but for someone who got into the series just by playing 5 minutes of the 3rd game, I really don't care.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069828347', 'num_games_owned': 317, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1031, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 381, 'playtime_at_review': 194, 'last_played': 1710633438}
review:
Basically [i]Serious Sam Fusion[/i] but for the Serious Engine 1 games.  Seems like it hasn't been updated in a while, which is unfortunate, but the devs might pick up on it again.

Recommended because it comes with [i]The First Encounter[/i] and [i]The Second Encounter[/i] -- which are great -- and because it has Workshop support.  Buy it if your computer's too weak for the HD remakes, or if you want to play mods, or if you like the old look of the games better than HD, or if you just want to pad your Library.

I could review the games themselves, but I haven't played [i]The Second Encounter[/i] in quite a while, which is unfortunate, because it is quite good, as I remember.  I could review [i]The First Encounter[/i], though, but I might not because it's almost 03:00 and I'm tired and lazy.  You didn't need to know these things, but now you do.  In a few years from now, some random event or lingering thought will remind you of the moment when you read a review that told you what time it was then went on to predict the act of you remembering it.  You will find it spooky, but not enough to really care.  Have a nice day.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055629534', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 2088, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1003, 'last_played': 1686652474}
review:
Serious Sam First and Second Encounter are great games and with Revolution gives you two great looking HD remasters of both Encounters as well as their classic versions. It also comes with a cool level builder that can allow anyone to easily make their own levels and share them. And of course, Co-oP in this game is a blast. The guys responsible for Revolution are doing a great job with these games so far and that makes me happy.

If you haven't played Serious Sam, get this. You're missing out on one of the craziest, fast-paced, hard-core shooters out there.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998672884', 'num_games_owned': 287, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 560, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 343, 'last_played': 1583606349}
review:
NOTE: This came out about 3 years [b]before[/b] Croteam decided to release [i]Serious Sam Fusion[/i], which uses an updated engine and graphics. So of course this version runs (somewhat) weaker and looks worse. Just bear in mind that there is another indie dev behind this project (Alligator Pit) when buying.

OT: Runny-gunny, shooty-bangy, blast-n'-strafe goodness all over. Now capable of running on modern hardware. Similar to the recent [i]Serious Sam Fusion 2017[/i], but uses the older style graphics.

Developers sadly haven't said a peep in nearly half a year, though. Which is rarely a good sign. Hopefully things tunr around.

Believe I got my copy for free when I bought [i]Serious Sam 1[/i] and [i]2[/i]. Same with [i]Fusion[/i]. It's almost like Croteam [i]wants [u]everyone[/u][/i] to play their games, and are just giving away beta builds now! It's crazy!

review:
Muito bom, FPS r√°pido e fren√©tico que exige muita movimenta√ß√£o do personagem devido √† quantidade imensa de inimigos que aparecem em todos os cantos da tela, inclusive na sua retaguarda. √â crucial saber movimentar bem e rapidamente o personagem com as teclas W, A, S e D. Nesse jogo isso √© mais importante do que atirar com precis√£o alta usando o mouse.

A hist√≥ria do jogo √© boba, vale mais pelo gameplay mesmo.

Na promo√ß√£o paguei dois reais apenas, quase de gra√ßa pelo o que oferece.

Acho meio chato jogar no Normal Mode pois √© muito dif√≠cil, assim jogo no Easy, pois nele o personagem tem mais energia.

Nota 8/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198293475838', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 727, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 562, 'last_played': 1535740736}
review: Es un buen juego aunque sea un Early Access beta pero lo unico malo es que no veo que lo actualizen cosa que en este tipo de juegos es muy raro ya que aun le quedan un par de prolemas como por ejemplo ( o bueno no se si me pasa solo a mi igual es algo que tengo que arreglar por mi cuenta o como dije antes es el juego) que la pantalla dividida o split screen por alguna razon el maus y teclado maneja a todos los jugadores y cuando digo a todos me refiero a los 4 yo que queria jugar esto com un amigo pero por ejemplo cuando el juega com el jugador 2 y yo com el 1 ( el jugador 2 usa mando de xbox 360 y el jugador 1 el teclado) cada vez que salto camino y apunto hacia los lados o hacia arriba y abajo el personaje de mi amigo tambien no importa si el tambien esta en movimiento hay como una especie de lucha entre los comandos de moviento cuando yo apunto a la derecha y el a la izquierda por favor para los que esten desarrollando este juego nesecito ayuda pero quitando eso el multiplayer o en un solo jugador esta muy bueno y divertido sin mencionar que el juego tiene workshop

author: {'steamid': '76561198275427433', 'num_games_owned': 358, 'num_reviews': 206, 'playtime_forever': 163916, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47290, 'last_played': 1679263548}
review:
For all fans of the first two episodes of Serious Sam and for those who have always wanted to invite the charming army to their home: This is your last chance! Complete "First Encounter" and "Second Encounter" missions, for ultimate action fun. From the beginnings in the hot desert of Egypt to the snowy mountain ranges in the Land of the Damned - Sam always has a finger at the trigger. Enjoy an action-packed high-speed roller coaster ride with hordes of enemies and sincere humor.

+ The complete content of First- and Second Encounter.
+ Total of 27 single player levels, packed with bats and more enemies than they could ever imagine
+ New Mode "Survival" with Total 6 new survival maps
+ Exclusive Revoultion Camapign Bright Island
+ A huge arsenal with 17 different weapons, including rocket launchers, flamers, sniper rifles, chainsaw, plasma thrower, mine layer, the ever-popular shotgun and the legendary Ghostbuster weapon
+ You can compete with other players against the enemy hordes in the highly praised packaged mode.
+ Lan and Internet multiplayer option for up to 16 in many different modes and with over 14 multiplayer maps

Top game instant purchase recommendation. If you buy Serious Sam Revolution you get the two classic Serious Sam games for free!

author: {'steamid': '76561198347198217', 'num_games_owned': 559, 'num_reviews': 211, 'playtime_forever': 3135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2924, 'last_played': 1518703642}
review: Serious Sam is a high-adrenaline old-school arcade-action shooter heavily focused on frantic arcade-style action. Serious Sam travels through the beautiful landscapes of Ancient Egypt, Mayan Civilization, Persian Empire and Medieval Europe, confronting the countless numbers of Mental's hordes hell-bent on destroying the human race. You are Sam "Serious" Stone. Welcome to the fight!

author: {'steamid': '76561198067706021', 'num_games_owned': 567, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1967, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 578, 'last_played': 1546633909}
review:
Classic mouse bashing shooter as its best!
For all who loved Serious Sam First and Second Encounter will also love this game.
Its a remake of BOTH titles with all the things you know but with steam achievments and it must have a little bit better graphics as the original version.
It is still early access but I never encountered a bug or crash. So it is really playable. :)
It also has a multiplayer.

author: {'steamid': '76561197965600590', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 322, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 294, 'last_played': 1660454300}
review:
This is essentially the ZDoom of Serious Sam, though it isn't feature complete yet. The original First and Second encounter have issues running on modern hardware, and have terrible mouse control. This version fixes most of these inconveniences.

However it is buggy from time to time. Playing co-op with a friend, Aludran Reptiloids would occasionally slide off their sniping platforms and fall off the map. Considering typically all enemies must be eliminated to continue, this can be a problem. Sometimes getting grenades or cannonballs to fall off the maps as well can get the kill, but gameplay bugs like this are not something I ever encountered in the original Serious Sam or the HD remakes.

Hopefully all these issues will be ironed out when this is finished eventually, as the co-op options and gameplay are generally superior in this version when compared to the HD remakes. Despite its flaws, this is the definitive version of Serious Sam.

author: {'steamid': '76561198112868374', 'num_games_owned': 637, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 56799, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1703285045}
review: Paket gibi oyun yapmƒ±≈ülar m√ºbarek. Serious Sam hayranƒ±ysanƒ±z bu oyunu kesinlikle k√ºt√ºphanenize ekleyin. ƒ∞ndirim ile 1.80 gibi ucuz bir fiyata Old School grafiklerle ve tabiki Serious Sam ile FPS deneyiminin dibine vurabilirsiniz.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970480657', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 7425, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 928, 'last_played': 1644002944}
review:
The way Serious Sam was meant to be played!

This is a heavily updated version of SS classic which includes both games for a very low price! It combines both campagins into one, making a completely new SS game and a true fusion which does it so much better than the HD versions!

This was made by true SS fans and they have promised a new capaign with new enemies and a boss sometime in the future!

To make this even better, this version of SS has 3 brand new weapons! These fit into the SS universe very well and they are a blast to use. Make sure you look up a secrets walkthough in the community gudes section to find them.

If SS2 was way too silly, if SS3 didnt tickle your fancy or if the HD versions were all too flashy for you then this is the best way to enjoy the full SS experience

You seriously wont be dissapointed!

author: {'steamid': '76561198074326131', 'num_games_owned': 360, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 1713, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 687, 'last_played': 1567436678}
review:
At first, you may think this game is garbage, and that it's for masochistic people who don't understand what 'fun' means.

Trust me, brother/sister, I've been there, done that. Then, something dawns on you, you can do it.

Yeah, the enemy placement can be pretty frustrating (*cough* Great Pyramids *cough*) and the enemies may seem pretty unfair and not fun to fight against, but every enemy has their own counter and easy way to get killed.

The easiest way to describe this game is as a more brutal, yet equally more satisfying Doom, with the charisma and weapon design of Duke Nukem (the Coachgun is as big as a damn zweihander) and with guns that work much like in Quake or Unreal Tournament.

If you want to see how hardcore of a FPS gamer you are, this game will test your mettle. There's rarely a moment when you get a breather, save for a few starting missions.

If we were to use the retarded number scoring system, I'd give this game a solid 9 Evil Nick Cage stares. 

Oh, and a tip: F6 is Quicksave. You'll need it, trust me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055322484', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 50543, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37474, 'last_played': 1700789417}
review:
You will travel through ancient civilizations and fight Mental's hordes in order to save humanity. You are Serious Sam, the world's only hope of survival.

The amount of enemies on screen is unseen in any kind of fps game. 100+ monsters on the screen are easily possible.

In order to fight these hordes, you will be given a diverse and destructive arsenal, ranging from a colt, to a tommy gun, up to even a portable cannon.

The game features multiple difficulty modes, which will allow any type of player to have fun in this game. 

Serious Sam also has a diverse set of game modes: single player, survival, co-op, co-op survival, deathmatch, team deathmatch, capture the flag, king of the hill and score attack.

The game is fair and it takes some practice to master. Look out for secrets which will make your life much easier.

The graphics of this game are still amazing today and were pretty realistic for its time. 

Serious Sam Revolution also comes with the Steam Workshop, which will allow you to play custom maps, custom models, music and huds.

Revolution also includes both original classic games and a brand new visually stunning campaign, called Bright Island.

Stuck in early access hell but other than that it's the ideal SS classic game

author: {'steamid': '76561198072680595', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 145, 'playtime_forever': 1188, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1188, 'last_played': 1500241210}
review:
Dis game is gud!!!!
Ok. Lets get serious. You play as Sam and he doen't have a serious bone in his body. The game is set in Egypt, a jungle and a Eurpoean town (I think). There are more the 10 weapons in this game, and Sam carries them all at once, like a real man. The levels are huge with a huge number of enemies at a time. Sometimes more that a 100 enemies swarm the player. Luckily the AI is idiotic, whith every enemie trying to kill you, with no personal regard for saftey. Thats okay because the challange comes from the number of enemies and not their intellegence. The game is in Early Access but includes the complete campaigns from The First Encounter and The Second Encounter. They are planning on releasing a third campagin. That is great value for 10$. Get this game ASAP.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025851707', 'num_games_owned': 481, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1735, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1569, 'last_played': 1523211313}
review:
It has been years since this game came on steam, and it's still in early acces.
There are still bugs which haven't fixed. You can report them on a forum, but after such a long time since it's initial release everything should have been fixed by now.
Also, when they update the game (which they do every so months) your savegames can't be used anymore since they only respond to an older version. 
I was about to wait until the game was totally finished, before I'll play the game again, but it seems it will be finished never.
This is such a pity, since outside these irritating things, it is a good game.
But you shouldn't buy it before it's out of early access, which will (I think) be never.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050955288', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1332, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1281, 'last_played': 1519162899}
review:
Un Must des FPS √† l'ancienne, acheter ce jeu au lieu d'acheter les versions classiques de serious sam.
+ L'originalit√© du gameplay, un fps qui repose sur la vitesse ou vous eliminez les ennemis et la maniere dont vous gerait l'envirronement et les objets pour ne pas etre submerger par la vague d'ennemis ce qui fait de ce jeu une sorte de melange entre le FPS et le tower defense (la mobilit√© en plus bien sur) 
+ La campagne de first et de second encounter, ce qui donne un FPS de +15 heures de jeu si vous torcher rapidement les niveaux ce qui est plus que correct sans prendre en compte les secrets
+ Facile √† tourner et √† optimiser. (comme souvent chez les jeux CROTEAM)
+ Possibilit√© de modder le jeu comme pour serious sam 3
+ Une tr√©s bonne OST 
+ Des armes en plus qui n'etait pas dans les versions classiques
+ Des excellentes map survie, enfin des map digne de ce nom qui change des horrible map survie des version HD qui dur√© 2 minutes grand max
+Le solo Multijoueur
-Les combats multijoueur pas adapt√© au gameplay de serious sam
-La campagne bright island qui sortira peut etre en 2035 si on a de la chance
Donc une tr√©s bonne version de ce classique qui avait besoin d'une mise a jour.
Personnelement je recomande plutot cette version que les deux version HD, en tout cas vous y gagner clairement en terme de prix.
Vivement la fin de la beta.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987264809', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 1908, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 493, 'last_played': 1579564251}
review: Of all the Serious Sam games, the First and Second Encournters are the very best. I still love playing them, even since they were first released in early 2001 going forward. The Serious Sam 2 and 3 BFE had more progressive graphics, but never had the same feel and open world excitement the First and Second Encounter games had. This is still the best shooter series ever! I want to see more maps and levels being added to the Workshop, since this is early access beta. I am looking forward to see all the great things happening with Serious Sam Revolution! Highly recommended to all FPS fans and those who love surprises and open world gaming!

author: {'steamid': '76561198024697211', 'num_games_owned': 87, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 950, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 744, 'last_played': 1548273613}
review:
A great game, and an all time classic. Great graphics for it's age, and a fast paced gameplay, perfect for it's genere. A great mix between Doom and Duke Nukem, from wich it takes inspiration, no doubt. I recomend this game to anyone who likes First-Person Shooters, and great classics. Definitely not a waste of time. On the contrary, I think it's time well spent.
tl;dr: A great game that you should play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198271425797', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 267, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 267, 'last_played': 1475674117}
review: Great addition to the serious sam classic series. As a serious sam veteran I Iove some of the new features like changeable hud and the r as the reload key. I am wetting myself in exitment for the new campaign and maps.                   A solid 8 out of ten for this current version. I am sure the future update will be a ten.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068262862', 'num_games_owned': 284, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 5060, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4421, 'last_played': 1571079936}
review:
This game is good. I have got all of the achievements in 73h of playtime.

I will do some pros and cons for the game.

PROS
-The game is a classic
-You can play in FPS or 3rdPS mode
-A lot of aliens to destroy
-Both TFE and TSE are included in this game
-Another campaign is in development called Bright Island
-When you buy Serious Sam Classics: Revolution, you get both Classic TFE and TSE games separately
-3 new weapons added to the game
-Not many bugs, nothing compared to some other games
-Graphics are the same as in both Classic Serious Sam's from '01 and '02
-The achievements aren't hard to get, just a couple of ones that need a lot of grinding

CONS
-The community is not big as it should be for Early Access games
-The Multiplayer is almost dead, but some servers can be found
-Stats aren't saved for TSE, I had addressed this issue in the Forum but I got no answer from the Devs so you have to pass the whole TSE in one run for a CO-OP achievement
-The Netcode is really bad, worser then in original Classic Serious Sam games

I recommend this game. 7/10 would relive those Encounters again!

author: {'steamid': '76561198027873867', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 119, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 119, 'last_played': 1473995138}
review: Serious Sam, if you don't know by now, is a crazy FPS game where hundreds of monsters relentlessly try to kill you until you kill them. It's fun. Play it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013216453', 'num_games_owned': 782, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 405, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 371, 'last_played': 1632974159}
review: For this Duke Nukem clone back in the day, Crotream really thinked big. Big Maps, Legions of enemies, lots of weapons, lots of fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993814722', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 19200, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19194, 'last_played': 1697562761}
review:
This had a LOT of potential. Sadly, it got totally ruined by complete incompetence. And after the original team was gone and all the work got transferred to Croteam, they just "released" it out of Early Access as is and left it to rot.

This "game" only has so much over the original encounters (TFE & TSE) that I personally wouldn't recommend playing this over the originals.

If you want almost identical Revolution experience without playing Revolution itself, look up "Serious Sam Classics Patch" and "Bright Island Classic" for [b]Serious Sam Classic: The Second Encounter[/b] instead. You can thank me later.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990969478', 'num_games_owned': 1145, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 2946, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2595, 'last_played': 1568484618}
review:
Don't bother with this, this "enhanced" port does not add or retain any significant important core features to bring it to the modern era of games, instead, a few features were cut off, and in their place a ton of minor enhancements were put. Bugs with widescreen FoV are still abound, like camera clipping, MiP Mapping issues, brush rendering bugs, instability, and netcode that has absolutely no correction algorythms to compensate for the eventual drift between the host's and the client's games. A lot of these bugs were bugs I pointed out long before the game got put on Steam, and they never got touched upon.

Another poor implementation is how workshop items are handled. Sometimes items conflict with each other and causes hard crashes, and what needed to be done is to disable items one by one until the problem is identified. The thing is, the game has no internal Workshop manager system like you see in Serious Sam HD and Serious Sam 3, and plus, SSRev doesn't even bother with cleaning up the Workshop folder, so one would have to unsubscribe from the item, then manually search out the files in question that matches said item, and delete them one by one. A proccess that has been made needlessly cumbersome.

You're far better off sticking to the original Classics version and tinkering with console commands to tweak your settings. At least then, you have access to content that will never be ported to SSrev, like fully-fledged mods.

review:
Jednym zdaniem: Serious Sam to czysta adrenalina i FPS, kt√≥ry nawet nie pr√≥buje udawaƒá, ≈ºe jest czym≈õ innym ni≈º prostƒÖ rozwa≈ÇkƒÖ. Dla tych kt√≥rzy nie wiedzƒÖ - Powa≈ºny Sam to taki trochƒô nastƒôpca Duke Nukem czyli FPS na mocnym luzie. Revolution to nowy remaster, kt√≥ry ma swoje plusy i minusy.

Plusy:

+ dobra okazja (za darmo dostajemy 2 czƒô≈õci Serious Sama - First i Second Encounter)

Minusy:

Komu polecam? / Komu odradzam?

- odradzam tym graczom, kt√≥rzy szukajƒÖ bardziej rozbudowanej rozgrywki, 
- odradzam graczom, kt√≥rzy lubiƒÖ anga≈ºowaƒá siƒô mocno w grƒô

author: {'steamid': '76561198025677794', 'num_games_owned': 260, 'num_reviews': 130, 'playtime_forever': 3500, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3389, 'last_played': 1626366995}
review:
To me, its the best version of the TFE and TSE games and the other extra things are nice too.

I just hope they manage to fix the water collison in the future (and adding the other promised contents/features as well)

some thoughts about the game for ppl who dont know anything about SS series

its more like a "kill the sam simulator" its not a fun game like doom/quake
Game is challenging u with different enemies, enemy counts and spawn rates in closed arenas or big open areas.
AI has pathing issue(stuck in walls), hence why the high count and empty level design.
very hard game, and sadly to much content is locked behind exploring and for higher difficulties (serious sam games have one of the worst difficulty scaling model)

TFE:
simple, but effective gameplay and level design.Its not rare to feel bad about the dull level design and pacing, especially on lower difficulties
u have all the weapons u need and all weapons work different, however i am not fan of rocket spamming in fps games
terrible pacing on lower difficulties

TSE:
introduction of:
-power ups
-new weapons: sniper rifle,chainsaw,flamethrower and serious bomb
-platforming
-better level design and more variety with 3 "theme"
-new enemies

TFE is the real one, once u know how to play

author: {'steamid': '76561198007728761', 'num_games_owned': 511, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 2113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1761, 'last_played': 1447850358}
review:
[b] Serious Sam um dos classicos anos 2000's, jogo muito legal e dinamico as vezes chega ser chato pq quanto vc passa em cada mapa ou miss√£o v√£o aparece os monstros ent√£o vc j√° tem que ficar preparado pra ver o que vai acontecer

A Historia come√ßa quanto o lider dos aliens chamado mental ame√ßa destruir humanidade mais sam vai impedir que isso aconte√ßa, usando o time-lock uma m√°quina do tempo que pode fazer viagens no tempo, construido pelos sirian que s√£o uma outra ra√ßa alien√≠gena que n√£o quis destruir a humanidade e sim ajudar-los ou deixar que as pessoas descubram sobre si mesmo

Sei que o jogo √© antigo demais, √© aqueles estilo de doom, hard reset, etc que s√£o chamados de ''cyberpunk'' aonce sempre v√£o aparecer os inimigos do nada e tem ficar muito alerto e preparado, ent√£o se vc curtir aquele jogos de cyberpunk ou algo assim, √© um game legal at√© vale a pena mais se vc j√° n√£o gosta desses tipo de fps, eu recomendo vc n√£o compra, enfim o jogo √© legal e tem uma pequena otima historia, s√≥ os prontos negativos dele √© que aparece inimigos demais e do nada, as vezes aparece at√© nas suas costas, chega ser muito chato mesmo kk, enfim minha nota √© 7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197991708280', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 645, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 510, 'last_played': 1466870020}
review:
Ok, I'm old compared to the bulk of gamers these days but at early FPS games I was a god and could own anyone. This game rekindled my love of those halcion days again. 

It's fast, interesting model wise (classic Serious Sam in 1080p for gods sake) and most importantly it's amazingly good FUN.

It's FPS gaming Nirvana.

Look, I'll spell this out. If you enjoy FPS you'll enjoy this. Forget the world around you, immerse yourself in it's full on universe, revel in the all time great punchlines, the varied hordes, the FEEL.

The FEEL is the best part. Not emotionally but physically. The enemy hordes react properly to being shot. There are no did I hit that moments, you hit something it reacts like its been properly  hit. It's a visceral, almost tactile, experience and can't be explained until you play it, it just feels RIGHT.

If it's wrong to love a virtual shotgun then arrest me, I'm guilty m'lud :)

Treat yourself to a guilty pleasure, just go and get this now. It's old school but it's PROUD of it in every possible good and meaningful way. It's not just some newbie knob knocking up a half baked low res platformer that would have sucked even back in the 80's or a cash grab by a talentless tosser using stock items on an engine that should never have seen the light of day.

This is the REAL DEAL and it's awesome.

It's an EAG, so given the community/developers it'll only get better and it's @@@@ing awesome already.

10/10 would kill and kill and kill again. 

Keep up the great work guys. Despite some minor if frustrating update errors (don't kill peoples save games) this is a stone cold WINNER !!

Many thanks for this, you've made me very happy, very happy indeed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010993600', 'num_games_owned': 862, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 183, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1464440347}
review:
Wait until after it's out of Early Access. The team are doing great things to modernise and optimise the game, but as somebody who just wants to play the thing I can't stand every update breaking my save files. There's a command to circumvent the error, but that just throws up a different error because they've quite obviously updated and improved the code since the previous saves. I suppose it's unavoidable given that it's Early Access, but that also makes it somewhat unplayable.

As far as I could tell, there was no warning or indication that this may happen to your save file upon starting the game.

review:
Very buggy, glitches everywhere, texture flickering, monsters disappearing... Sacred yards in first encounter is unplayable (had to save/load like 10 times in some places because I was dropping from the map while walking and fps down to 1, also insta dying to invisible things like i was being smashed), also the final boss once he climbs the pyramid gets stuck on the floor and is trying to move but he ends just walking in place which renders the final boss battle impossible as he is regenrating his hp with no way to make him go to the center to kill him with the teleport.
Avoid playing this version and stick to the classic or HD editions untill this one gets properly done with the new campaign!
developer_response: The bug in Sacred Yards has been fixed a few updates ago.

author: {'steamid': '76561198148114260', 'num_games_owned': 924, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1041, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 983, 'last_played': 1596395166}
review:
Serious Sam will always hold a special place in my heart as a series that kickstarted my love for...well, games, to be completely honest with you (Timesplitters was the series that kept my interest for the long term.) I highly doubt that I would be enjoying games if Serious Sam and Timesplitters didn't show me just how fun, crazy and satisfying it can be. But I don't necessarily want to be reviewing Serious Sam as a game here, as chances are if you're reading this review you've already played a Serious Sam game. Instead, let's focus on the fan-remake, Classics: Revolution.

There isn't much to say really. The gameplay is near-identical to how I remember it on the original Xbox, and since the Xbox version I played was pretty different to the First and Second Encounter I was somewhat surprised. If, like me, you've never played the original on PC, the workshop support will allow you to change the enemy models and HUD to something you remember. The workshop support also helps enhance and prolong the replayability, as custom maps are actually still being added and the ones I've played have all been excellent. The engine is smooth and well-optimized, and if any graphical tweaks are needed then you're at full liberty to do so with an expansive options menu (that can be somewhat confusing to navigate) This game may seem a bit pointless considering there are HD editions, but I found that Classics: Revolution has the most resemblance to the Serious Sam I know and love. Plus, the First and Second Encounters are conjoined in this game, whereas the HD versions are split and have different features in both, which is frustrating to say the least. 

Onwards to the negative. Yes, this is Early Access. Yes, this is fan-made. As such, there are a number of bugs that are annoying but rarely game-breaking. They are still there, however. Some issues I've ran into are enemies getting stuck behind objects and walls frequently, which makes it a lot easier to shotgun them to pieces, some buttons required for puzzles and secrets actually won't work depending on what gun you're holding, and graphical glitches such as clipping through the wall ever so slightly if you brush against one (this one is perfectly manageable, since it happens on other games frequently, such as Skyrim, and doesn't take up a lot of screen space) I've also experienced crashes, especially every time I tab out. 

However, these negatives are still minor because this Early Access game is feature complete as hell. I haven't yet had the chance to try out online multiplayer but I've tried local co-op and it works fine. Definitely buy this if you like Serious Sam because I think it is better than the HD versions because it's a lot closer to the original with better looking graphics that match the original's style completely.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076123131', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 68, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1500343487}
review:
Serious Sam Classics: Revolution is a great game! It combines the first two Serious Samanthas into one game. I reccomend this over individually buying the two original games. The gameplay is well designed and thought out and is no different from the originals. The graphics are nice (For the time.) and atmospheric. The enemies are very different from each other. They range from a Domo looking thing and some sort of Scorpion with a gun. Pretty creative I must say. The level design is great! Love it. Almost all old games have great level design, just to keep the player interested. We don't have that today in our First Person Shooters. The comedy, which may not be for all is still pretty funny. 

FINAL SCORE
8/10 To much water.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042831386', 'num_games_owned': 598, 'num_reviews': 627, 'playtime_forever': 1964, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1964, 'last_played': 1450736560}
review:
[h1]Short version: 81%[/h1] 
For those who missed the original Serious Sam games, Revolution is the best choice right now: by combining both Encounters and updating them to meet today's technical standards, it lets everyone equally enjoy this old-school shooter series, testing their abilities (and the power of their serious arsenal) against hordes upon hordes of monsters. 
 
[h1]Long version:[/h1]
When the original Serious Sam games got too outdated to play them without issues on modern systems, the developers decided to just remake them entirely in their then-newest engine as HD editions. There were some players though who preferred the original‚Äì either for the lower requirements, the old-school looks, or because they didn‚Äôt like the small level and gameplay changes. So, they disassembled the old engines and completely remade them as a single package, completed with a series of bug fixes and some community levels.
The result was Revolution, which turned out to be so good that now it even replaced the original First and Second Encounters in the Steam store. 

If you never met this series, then buckle up, because Serious Sam is a very old-school FPS. There are no covers or health regeneration (unless you play the sissy difficulty), and the enemies won‚Äôt stop in the distance to make sure the player has time to kill them at their leisure. Here, you have to gruellingly cut, burn, slice, shoot, and explode your way through courtyards upon courtyards of alien monsters in ancient Egypt, the Maya Empire, Babylon, and medieval Europe. 
This may suggest some grim and gritty tone, but Serious Sam is also known for its cheesy humour, usually in the form of corny one-liners‚Äì mimicking the worst of 80s action movie clich√©s‚Äì or goofy secrets. This combination of hardcore action and nonsensical writing was one of the reasons Serious Sam reached its cult classic status, and the reason anyone who never played it should do so at least once.

[i]You can also follow the [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/completingthebacklog#curation]Completing the Backlog Curator page[/url] for more reviews![/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561198176433503', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 86, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 72, 'last_played': 1495689589}
review: I gave it a quick test run - both in single player training, and against myself in split screen . It's a good old time first person shooter, with local competitive action - which is just what I wanted for my travelling toy box ( I mean my lap top ) . I didn't see any option in the mutators for this, so I'll suggest some AI bots in the split screen mode, to add to the fun . ( If you're playing one on one, just running around and looking for the other guy to shoot can be a drag, but a few dozen murderous space freeks can really spice up the action .) Nifty little game on the overall - keep going!

author: {'steamid': '76561198207433584', 'num_games_owned': 1025, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 558, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 179, 'last_played': 1614403053}
review: Loved playing this game as a kid and would still be playing it (if my sister didn't break the disk ;-;) I love that this features the two first serious sam games and also that the multiplayer has been improved! Adding the ability to make and play custom maps/level! one of my favourite things about this is the fact it's being worked on by fans. Great job keep it up and i would recommend this game to anybody looking for a good classic fps game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198126975019', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 746, 'playtime_forever': 1859, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 960, 'last_played': 1689652628}
review:
This are fantastic games, and if you haven‚Äôt played them yet, or, if you have only played the HD remasters/remakes, then you owe it to yourself to give this version a try.

Serious Sam Classics: Revolution it‚Äôs a game that incorporates both the original Serious Sam game, The First Encounter, as well as its sequel, The Second Encounter.

It merges them together in a package filled with technical tweaks that optimize both games for modern systems, adding widescreen resolution support, as well as other settings such as an fov slider.

I didn‚Äôt experience any issues other than a weird a common bug that makes it difficult to jump out of the water at times, luckily this can easily be ‚Äúbypassed‚Äù by jumping just before the ledge that you‚Äôre trying to climb instead of just walking towards it.

Then there was also some glitching around some walls if I came to close to them, but I think it had to do with me playing with the highest fov setting available, a fair tradeoff in my opinion.

Besides that, no crashes, no framerate drops, and for the most part, flawless performance.

As for the games, the premise is fairly simple, you move through wide and open areas that are surrounded by beautiful ‚Äúancient culture‚Äù scenery, as you ‚Äúblast‚Äù your way through thousands of enemies that come towards you in hordes.

All of the enemies in Serious Sam are deeply characteristic, and unique, they all have different attacks to keep you paying attention, for the most part all you have to do its dodge the incoming projectiles, or screaming kamikaze enemies.
And that‚Äôs pretty much it‚Ä¶

But the game stays fresh and enjoyable.

The first game in my opinion does get a tad bit too repetitive at times, that‚Äôs principally because as much as the levels, and areas you go through change in their design, the appearance of this areas doesn‚Äôt.

So pretty much the entirety of the first game takes place in Egypt, it‚Äôs unique at first and very beautiful aesthetically, but eventually it becomes a bit jarring to look at the same textures, sand, and pillars, over, and over, again.

The second game corrects this by not only changing the environments the levels take place in, but also by adding different obstacles in some cases, or alternatively altering how some rooms work.

At times you find yourself in one that‚Äôs a cylinder of sorts, the catch it‚Äôs that you can run around the entire area defying gravity in the process as the room keeps filling with dozens of enemies.

The pacing it‚Äôs also a lot better in the second game simply because of the way these obstacles are presented into the levels, how some of the levels change in their aesthetic as well as in their design, and also because the weapon distribution its balanced and generous.

The second game it‚Äôs divided in three areas that take away your carried weapons at the start of each one of them, it might seem annoying at first but in reality, it‚Äôs a brilliant decision that ends up making each area feel new, and each weapon pickup, even when previously carrying every single one of them, feel fresh.

The gunplay it‚Äôs also fantastic and probably the principal reason as to why the original games remain superior to the subsequent remakes that came after.

Each and every weapon that you carry its useful in different situations, the rocket launcher it‚Äôs great to take down groups of enemies that are closed together, the double-barreled shotgun it‚Äôs a nice compromise to take down single enemies that are separated from one an another, the minigun allows you to take plenty of individual enemies at once but smaller ones with low amounts of health at that.

Then there‚Äôs a series of other ones that I‚Äôm too lazy to describe, but each and every single one of them have a different purpose and a satisfying feel to them.

Pair that up with the enemies blowing into red pieces of meat, shared with the absurd and ridiculous blood effects that you can change to your liking, either for different colors, or simply to disable the entire effect, and you have a gunplay that ends up feeling incredibly satisfying and enjoyable to partake in.

I do recommend this game, and this particular version over the remasters for the simple reason the gameplay it‚Äôs significantly superior to those versions, the weapons do just the right amount of damage, the enemies have just the right amount of health, and the levels are as silly and enjoyable as you expect them to be.

In comparison to the other versions that do look significantly better but that sadly both change some aspects of the gunplay, paired with some minor but noticeable changes to the level design, as well as to how many hits certain enemies take to kill, this version remains faithful and balanced to meet the original games idea of trading off realism for silliness and fun.
